item.title: What Should I Do When I See Pornography?
item.description: The challenges that children face today related to pornography are tremendous, but armed with the right information about what to do when they encounter it, they can successfully overcome the challenge and lead safe, happy lives.

item.title: Step One: Honesty
item.description: This video describes step one in the Addiction Recovery Program: Admit that you, of yourself, are powerless to overcome your addictions and that your life has become unmanageable.

item.title: Step Two: Hope
item.description: This video describes step two in the Addiction Recovery Program: Come to believe that the power of God can restore you to complete spiritual health.

item.title: Step Three: Trust in God
item.description: This video describes step three in the Addiction Recovery Program: Decide to turn your will and life over to the care of God the Eternal Father and His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Step Four: Truth
item.description: This video describes step four in the Addiction Recovery Program: Make a searching and fearless written moral inventory of yourself.

item.title: Step Five: Confession
item.description: This video describes step five in the Addiction Recovery Program: Admit to yourself, to your Heavenly Father in the name of Jesus Christ, to proper priesthood authority, and to another person the exact nature of your wrongs.

item.title: Step Six: Change of Heart
item.description: This video describes step six in the Addiction Recovery Program: Become entirely ready to have God remove all your character weaknesses.

item.title: Step Seven: Humility
item.description: This video describes step seven in the Addiction Recovery Program: Humbly ask Heavenly Father to remove your shortcomings.

item.title: Step Eight: Seeking Forgiveness
item.description: This video describes step eight in the Addiction Recovery Program: Make a list of all persons you have harmed and become wiling to make restitution to them.

item.title: Step Nine: Restitution and Reconciliation
item.description: This video describes step nine in the Addiction Recovery Program: Wherever possible, make direct restitution to all persons you have harmed.

item.title: Step Ten: Daily Accountability
item.description: This video describes step ten in the Addiction Recovery Program: Continue to take personal inventory, and when you are wrong promptly admit it.

item.title: Step Eleven: Personal Revelation
item.description: This video describes step eleven in the Addiction Recovery Program: Seek through prayer and meditation to know the Lord's will and to have the power to carry it out.

item.title: Step Twelve: Service
item.description: This video describes step twelve in the Addiction Recovery Program: Having had a spiritual awakening as a result of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, share this message with others and practice these principles in all you do.

item.title: Twelve Steps to Recovery
item.description: Coordinators and participants in the LDS 12-step addiction recovery program share their stories and their testimonies of the program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Kerri
item.description: Kerri is devastated by her husband's addiction to pornography, but finds hope and healing through the Atonement of Jesus Christ. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Troy
item.description: Troy faces the reality of his addiction to pornography. Through honesty, repentance, and the healing power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, he finds peace. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Hetzel
item.description: When Hetzel discovered that her husband was selling drugs and falling deeper into a drug addiction, she felt betrayed and hopeless. She found strength and hope through the Atonement.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Sherrie
item.description: Sherrie alone and isolated, like there must be something fundamentally wrong with her. Through the miracle of the atonement of Jesus Christ, she finally found the ability to overcome her addiction to sex and pornography.

item.title: Meet Ismael
item.description: Ismael knew he needed a change, but thought he could fight his drug addiction alone. When he attended the recovery program, he had success because he learned to apply the principles of repentance.

item.title: Meet McKay
item.description: McKay's drug addiction landed him in jail. In his cell, he read the Book of Mormon and felt the power of Jesus Christ that had been missing in his life.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Lou Ann
item.description: Lou Ann was addicted to heroin and meth for 37 years. While in jail, she received an answer to prayer that gave her hope. The Addiction Recovery Program and the Atonement of Christ changed her life.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Karen
item.description: Karen was a nurse, student, and mother who became addicted to pain medications. The Addiction Recovery Program helped her regain control of her life and develop a new relationship with Jesus Christ.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Michael
item.description: Michael was an alcoholic and a meth addict. When his life spiraled out of control he realized he needed spiritual help. The atonement of Jesus Christ helped him turn his life completely around.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Sidreis
item.description: Sidreis is recovering from a sexual addiction. The atonement helped heal the deep personal wounds she felt.

item.title: Addiction Recovery - Meet Rod
item.description: Rod was an alcoholic and cocaine addict. From a young age, he would lie and steal for his addiction. In his darkest moment, he decided to change his life and welcome the power of the Savior’s Atonement.

item.title: LDS Addiction Recovery Program: Meet Mark
item.description: Mark could feel God reaching out for him, even though he was an addict, an alcoholic and hadn't tried to follow God's commandments.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Loving and Serving Others
item.description: Not long after Elder and Sister Olsen were married, they had a desire to serve a mission. They chose to serve in the Addiction Recovery Program, where they learned to serve with unconditional love.

item.title: A Time and a Season
item.description: Church-service missionaries serve in the addiction recovery program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Why should parents talk to their children about sexual intimacy?
item.description: Children and youth receive so many toxic and distorted messages about sexual intimacy. The home is the ideal place to teach them. It's up to parents to teach them plainly and boldly.

item.title: What if talking about sexual intimacy makes me uncomfortable?
item.description: It's worth the discomfort to talk to children about sexual intimacy. If we don't, someone else will.

item.title: How often do I have to talk to my children about healthy sexual intimacy?
item.description: Lessons about sexual intimacy should be layered from little children until dating and marriage. It shouldn't be a onetime event.

item.title: How do we relate to our children?
item.description: If children know that you're comfortable talking about things and you understand them, they'll have an easier time talking to you.

item.title: What’s the biggest difference between what the world teaches and what the gospel teaches about sexuality?
item.description: The world emphasizes sex as just a physical experience. The gospel teaches, if in within the proper bounds of marriage, it's a unifying of the body and the spirit.

item.title: Should parents just talk about the physical aspect of healthy sexuality?
item.description: Parents need to focus on the emotional and relational side of sexuality in preparation for a strong marriage. Chastity does not end in marriage. Teach children why sex means so much more in a healthy marriage relationship.

item.title: Why should you start teaching about intimacy early?
item.description: Starting as a toddler is a great way to prevent sexual abuse. A great way to start with young children is to talk about the differences between boys and girls.

item.title: How do you know when it’s a good teaching moment?
item.description: We need to do as much as possible to be available to our children. The best moments for teaching aren’t always the most convenient.

item.title: What should I share with my children?
item.description: Share your own experiences and let your children see a healthy relationship.

item.title: Is there help for me to teach my children?
item.description: You're not alone. There are a lot of great resources to help you teach. When you are teaching truth, the Spirit does help you.

item.title: What if I feel overwhelmed about teaching my children about intimacy?
item.description: Making this a priority will help you with a lot of other aspects of teaching. It will improve your relationship so that they'll come to you for questions with hard things.

item.title: How do Heavenly Father and the Spirit help you teach?
item.description: The Spirit will help you recognize each child's needs.

item.title: Should I be open about what I teach my children?
item.description: Children appreciate you being honest and open about intimacy.

item.title: What if I get discouraged?
item.description: Call upon Heavenly Father to help those messages stick with your children when you're not with them. Focus on progression, not perfection.

item.title: How do I focus on the positive aspects of healthy sexuality?
item.description: Sometimes we focus on the negative aspects of sexuality. Need to prepare children for healthy sexuality.

item.title: How do I focus on a gospel view of sexuality?
item.description: The world views sex as selfish and narcissistic. Sexual relations should be enjoyed in a healthy marriage relationship. People don't just need to enter marriage pure; they need to enter prepared.

item.title: How do you prepare youth for healthy sexual relations in marriage?
item.description: The scriptures often refer to sexual relations as "they knew someone." Social skills need to be developed in sex education to really get to know someone.

item.title: What’s the best thing parents can do to protect children from negative sexual influences?
item.description: Start teaching children young about healthy sexuality in a layered fashion. Teach it plainly and boldly. It needs to be done. Children are getting too few gospel messages and too many negative worldly messages.

item.title: How do you break the ice when talking with children about intimacy?
item.description: Tie these conversations about intimacy into life events. Always be looking for appropriate opportunities to bring it up.

item.title: What are some things not to do when teaching children about sex?
item.description: We don't want children to feel like they're bringing up something we don't discuss or we don't talk about. Be encouraging and invite. Let them know that mistakes are a part of life, but teach them about the Atonement.

item.title: Receiving a Testimony of the Book of Mormon, Part 1

item.title: Test Moroni’s Promise
item.description: (Moroni 10:3–5) Elder Richard G. Scott talks about testing Moroni’s promise.

item.title: Testimony of the Witnesses
item.description: (Ether 5) Elder Dallin H. Oaks shares the significance of more than one witness to the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Written for Us Today
item.description: (Mormon 8:34–35) President Ezra Taft Benson explains that the Book of Mormon was meant for our generation. We must, therefore, make it a center point of our study.

item.title: Prepared for Our Day
item.description: (Mormon 8:12–41) Elder L. Tom Perry explains that the Book of Mormon was prepared for our day.

item.title: Bible and Book of Mormon
item.description: (Mormon 7:8–10) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about the Bible and the Book of Mormon as witnesses of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Coming Forth of the Book of Mormon Signaled the Beginning of the Gathering of Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 29:1–2) President Ezra Taft Benson teaches the value of the Book of Mormon as a tool in converting the world to the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: The Book of Mormon Gathers Scattered Israel
item.description: (3 Nephi 21:1–7) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about how the Book of Mormon gathers scattered Israel.

item.title: ﻿A Message to Students of the Book of Mormon
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks to seminary students about the Book of Mormon.

item.title: Lillie
item.description: Lillie from Hawaii created the “aloha spirit” of love and friendship by sharing the Book of Mormon with doctors who treated her cancer.

item.title: Book of Mormon—Belinda
item.description: Belinda explains how the Book of Mormon confirms to her that Jesus is the Christ.

item.title: Book of Mormon—Rebecca
item.description: Rebecca bears testimony that the Book of Mormon testifies of Christ and is the word of God.

item.title: Book of Mormon—Lloyd
item.description: Lloyd says the Book of Mormon is a daily reminder of Jesus Christ, of faith, and of how to be obedient.

item.title: Book of Mormon—Rob
item.description: Rob came to know that the Book of Mormon is true by reading it.

item.title: Sitting on the Bench: Thoughts on Suicide Prevention
item.description: Suicidal thoughts are real and often begin when a person feels like the world would be better off without them. Sometimes, the most powerful tool to help someone is to simply reach out with friendship and words of love and encouragement.

item.title: True Christianity
item.description: When their best friend passes away, two men embark on an epic road trip to discover the meaning of “true Christianity.”

item.title: My Brother Hyrum
item.description: Learn about Hannah's relationship with her brother Hyrum who has autism, and how she exemplifies Christlike love. Everyone deserves to be loved and valued, no matter how different they are from you.

item.title: Riqui's Wheelchair
item.description: Although polio took away the use of his legs when he was young, Riqui has not let this disability stop him. Riqui's new wheelchair helps him in his effort to live a full life.

item.title: Chile Earthquake YSA Service

item.title: Chile Priesthood Response
item.description: Following a massive earthquake that struck Santiago, Chile, in February 2010, LDS Charities and local Church members helped people all throughout the city to obtain food, water, and shelter.

item.title: Quilts

item.title: World of Happiness
item.description: The Church donated materials and equipment to improve vision in Peru.

item.title: Bolivia Humanitarian Impact
item.description: The Church created lasting friendships with government officials in Bolivia through humanitarian efforts.

item.title: Haiti Emergency Response
item.description: After the earthquake in Haiti, members of the Church organized humanitarian efforts to assist those in need. The local meetinghouses were offered as medical and living areas.

item.title: Neonatal Resuscitation Training – Africa
item.description: Neonatal training is provided to local community nurses and doctors to improve infant mortality rates.

item.title: Samoa Tsunami Relief Effort
item.description: Church members were ready to help the victims of a tsunami that destroyed villages in Samoa. Food, supplies, and donated labor were provided to help rebuild homes.

item.title: Madera Vineyard Relief Society
item.description: Sisters volunteering at the Madera vineyard explain Relief Society's mission to serve.

item.title: Deseret Transportation
item.description: Deseret Transportation delivers goods to those in need.

item.title: Julie Rogers, Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Julie Rogers discusses her painting “Charity Never Faileth.”

item.title: Pass It On
item.description: Children around the world have taken President Thomas S. Monson's counsel to find a way to serve others.

item.title: Wise Men Still Seek Him
item.description: Three modern-day wise men show us that the greatest gift we can give Jesus Christ is the will of our hearts.

item.title: The Coat
item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: Charity Never Faileth
item.description: Plead for a desire to be filled with the gift of charity, the pure love of Christ.

item.title: The Miracle of The Roof
item.description: A group of 11 men from The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints assist a man by restoring his roof.

item.title: Melissa’s Ramp
item.description: Members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints seek opportunities to serve their fellowmen in their wards, communities, and beyond.

item.title: Our Hands, His Hands; Our Hearts, His Heart

item.title: The Sanctifying Work of Welfare
item.description: The work of caring for one another and being “kind to the poor” is a sanctifying work, commanded of the Father.

item.title: Dayton's Legs
item.description: A 13-year-old boy in Arizona fulfilled his Duty to God by pushing himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Gordon Hinckley: Lessons I Learned as a Boy
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley recalls a story of an older boy and his young companion as they find an old coat and a badly worn pair of shoes by the roadside.

item.title: Noble Women, Righteous Lives
item.description: The Relief Society blesses the lives of many worldwide. This video celebrates the efforts of women throughout the world.

item.title: Highlight: Sisterhood: Oh, How We Need Each Other—Bonnie L. Oscarson
item.description: Bonnie L. Oscarson teaches that we can learn from girls and women of all ages and that we must avoid judging each other.

item.title: Highlight: The Cost—and Blessings—of Discipleship—Jeffrey R. Holland
item.description: Jeffrey R. Holland encourages us to live the gospel faithfully and courageously, even when it is difficult.

item.title: Highlight: What Do You Think?—W. Craig Zwick
item.description: W. Craig Zwick encourages empathy for others and teaches that we must strive to understand what others are thinking.

item.title: Loving and Living with Differences
item.description: Highlight of Elder Dallin H. Oaks's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Are We Not All Beggars?
item.description: Highlight of Elder Jeffrey R. Holland's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: We Believe in Being Chaste
item.description: Obedience to the law of chastity will increase our happiness in mortality and make possible our progress in eternity.

item.title: We Believe in Being Chaste
item.description: Quote given by Elder David A. Bednar in the Saturday afternoon on April 6, 2013.

item.title: Unchastity Most Abominable
item.description: (Alma 39:1–11) President Boyd K. Packer speaks about chastity and the abomination of immorality.

item.title: Chastity
item.description: (Jacob 2:28) Elder Richard G. Scott teaches about chastity.

item.title: Standards: Sexual Purity and Modesty - True Confidence
item.description: Two young women share their secret for confidence and self-worth: the companionship of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Flee Fornication
item.description: (1 Corinthians 6:9-11 and 18-20) Elder Dallin H. Oaks talks about how we should flee fornication.

item.description: (Romans 1:24-27) President Boyd K. Packer warns against Satan's influence in perverting the sacred powers of procreation.

item.title: Guardians of Virtue
item.description: Prepare now so that you may qualify to receive all the blessings that await you in the Lord’s holy temples.

item.title: Guardians of Virtue
item.description: A Young Women choir from stakes in Salt Lake City sings “Guardians of Virtue.”

item.title: Guardians of Virtue: Young Women Song
item.description: The “Guardians of Virtue" song shares how young women can make righteous choices, bless others, and become who God wants them to be.

item.title: Law of Chastity
item.description: Church members explain the importance and blessings of obeying the law of chastity (sexual purity).

item.title: Return to Virtue

item.title: Virtue: For Such a Time as This

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: Mary conceives by the power of the Holy Ghost – Heavenly messengers herald the birth of Jesus in Bethlehem. Luke 1:26-38; 2:1-19; Matthew 1:20-21

item.title: Good Tidings of Great Joy: The Birth of Jesus Christ
item.description: Share the good tidings of great joy: that He lives! Luke 2:1-20

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples. Luke 1:26-35

item.title: The Nativity
item.description: The Christmas season is a time to celebrate the priceless gift of our Lord and Savior, Jesus Christ. His birth is more than the symbol of a holiday. He is the Son of God and the Redeemer of all mankind. mormon.org/Christmas

item.title: A Gift to the World
item.description: A video presentation titled “A Gift to the World,” shown as part of the First Presidency Christmas Devotional.

item.title: Why we need a Savior — A Christmas message about our Savior Jesus Christ. #ASaviorIsBorn.
item.description: What would life be like without a Savior? There would be no joy, no forgiveness, no hope for the future. This Christmas, learn more about the hope, peace and happiness our Savior Jesus Christ can bring into our lives at christmas.mormon.org.

item.title: The First Christmas Spirit
item.description: What would it have been like to raise Jesus Christ? Joseph was a humble carpenter when God gave him the responsibility of being Christ’s father.

item.title: He Is The Gift
item.description: The first gift of Christmas was a simple gift given by a father to all his children, to us. He gave us his son, the Christ. He is the gift. This Christmas season, how will you share the gift? http://www.christmas.mormon.org

item.description: A Savior is born. Each Christmas season we celebrate the birth of our Savior—the Son of God, who can save us from sin and sadness. Remember Him, love Him, and follow Him. Visit christmas.mormon.org

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.description: Christmas is a time when we can all learn from a child's gratitude and love for Jesus Christ. See the meaning and the story of Christmas through the eyes of children.

item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.description: Three modern-day wise men show us that the greatest gift we can give Jesus Christ is the will of our hearts.

item.title: Chapter 5: Jesus Christ Is Born
item.description: Jesus Christ is born in Bethlehem. Angels tell nearby shepherds of his birth, and they come to worship him.

item.description: Rosemary M. Wixom encourages girls and women of all ages to make and keep sacred covenants in order to return to Heavenly Father's presence.

item.title: Look to the Light
item.description: At Christmastime and always, Jesus Christ is the Light of the World for all who seek Him.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Vegetarian, and Green Energy Business Owner

item.title: The Creation
item.description: (Genesis 1; Moses 2) Elder Nelson explains the creation and its importance.

item.title: We Lived With God
item.description: A renowned scientist testifies of our premortal life, our divine Creator, and the limitless perspective of eternal life.

item.title: Jesus was God The Creator
item.description: (John 1:1-3) President Gordon B. Hinckley speaks of the beautiful creations of Jesus Christ.

item.description: (2 Nephi 2) Elder Russell M. Nelson speaks about the doctrine of Heavenly Father's plan of redemption.

item.title: My Brother Hyrum
item.description: Learn about Hannah's relationship with her brother Hyrum who has autism, and how she exemplifies Christlike love. Everyone deserves to be loved and valued, no matter how different they are from you.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, an IT professional, and I stand tall with God.
item.description: Being a little person can be hard but Luis Rojas has flourished through adversity. www.mormon.org/luisr

item.title: Works of God
item.description: Two families share how they have seen the works of God made manifest in their lives as ward members reach out in love and understanding.

item.description: A 13-year-old boy in Arizona fulfilled his Duty to God by pushing himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Brynn

item.title: Katie
item.description: Being born with Down syndrome doesn’t stop Katie from Florida from singing, dancing, and sharing a special Primary experience.

item.title: Ellen Joy
item.description: Allergic to many foods, Ellen Joy from North Carolina helps other children stay safe from allergies and encourages them to stand up for their own health.

item.title: Angels in Disguise

item.title: Able to Serve

item.title: Enduring Love
item.description: Watch how this couple demonstrates pure love and service in their marriage—even though they have to endure debilitating physical adversity.

item.description: See how faith and love can remain strong through the challenges and the changing seasons of our lives.

item.title: Lift

item.title: I'm a Mormon, French-Swiss, and Blind Chocolate Hunter
item.description: He is a blind connoisseur of good food in Geneva, Switzerland. She is his eyes. Together, this Mormon couple explores their city, eats chocolate and makes each other laugh. Visit Pierre page at www.mormon.org/pierre

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Sensei, and One-Legged Runner
item.description: A true karate master can overcome any challenge with faith, perseverance, and one strong leg. Tim Hurst, a Mormon marathon runner with one leg, finds strength in focusing on what he has. See more at www.mormon.org/Tim

item.title: I’m Jason Smyth and I’m a Mormon
item.description: Four time Paralympic gold medalist Jason Smyth may have limited vision, but he never lets challenges limit what he can accomplish. He know his talents are blessing from God. www.mormon.org/jasons

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Georgia Peach, and Mother of a Deaf Son
item.description: When Mormon Sherri found out that her son was deaf, she was frozen with fear. With hope in Jesus Christ, she moves forward with faith and has learned to speak in another way. www.mormon.org/sherri

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Chilean, and determined blind runner
item.description: Margarita Faundez has had her struggles but has risen above with great determination. www.mormon.org/margaritaf

item.description: Blind, Mormon guitarist Lorin Nicholson rode a bike from Perth to Sydney, but he didn’t see the country. He heard, felt, and smelled it. To him it was beautiful. Witness Lorin's love of life at www.mormon.org/lorin

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Amputee and Conqueror of Fears
item.description: Ingrid Maldonado lost her legs, but still stands tall. When you look in her eyes, you will not find frailty, but strength. You will not see fear, but hope. See photos at www.mormon.org/IngridM

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Athlete, and Amputee who Built a Leg
item.description: Jarem Frye is a bone cancer survivor and amputee who built his own replacement leg so he could mountain bike, rock climb, water and snow skiing - he does it all. See Jarem in action at www.mormon.org/jarem

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Father, and Homeland Security Expert
item.description: Despite having muscular dystrophy, Mormon Homeland Security Consultant Vance Taylor shows that a normal life is possible and that real happiness comes through family relationships. See Vance at www.mormon.org/vance

item.title: The Lord Provides a Way
item.description: After a debilitating bicycle accident, Emmannuel Nochi discovered he still could still serve a mission as a young Church-service missionary.

item.title: Serving with a Great Purpose
item.description: Elder Ito doesn’t allow his disability to stop him from serving as a young Church-service missionary following the loss of a loved one.

item.title: We Don’t Need to Be the Same to Be One
item.description: We are different by design. Embrace the “and.”

item.title: The Prince of Peace: Find Lasting Peace through Jesus Christ
item.description: Find peace in a troubled world by learning more of Jesus Christ. This Easter season, learn principles of peace from the #PRINCEofPEACE. Get started at mormon.org.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Forgiveness #PrinceofPeace
item.description: It’s impossible to find lasting peace without forgiving and being forgiven. We’ve all been wronged by others and have made mistakes of our own, but that doesn’t mean we can’t find peace by turning to Jesus Christ.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Faith #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Many people, if they were given only 15 months to live, would sink into despair. But through her faith in Jesus Christ, Kristin found the strength to carry on. Learn how her faith helped her to trust in God’s plan for her family.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Hope #PrinceofPeace
item.description: One of the greatest blessings of following Jesus Christ is the knowledge that we can be with our loved ones again after death. This knowledge can give us the hope we need to get through our darkest times.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Gratitude #PrinceofPeace
item.description: We can show gratitude by being thankful for all that Jesus Christ has made possible in our lives. Jon’s upbringing could have made him focus on what his life lacked. However, he chose instead to dwell on all the wonderful things he had.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Compassion #PrinceofPeace
item.description: The greatest example of service is Jesus Christ, who gave freely of Himself without any thought of reward. When we follow His example by serving others, we can discover peace even amid turmoil in our lives.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Repentance #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Thanks to the sacrifice of Jesus Christ, we all have the ability to repent—to be free from the guilt and burden of our past sins. Learn how Melody put her past behind her with Jesus’s help and was able to find peace in her new life.

item.title: Principles of Peace: God’s Word #PrinceofPeace
item.description: When we read about Christ and study His words, we find His example and teachings to follow. This understanding can bring us the peace we seek in our lives. Learn how Amelia found peace through searching the word of God.

item.title: Principles of Peace: Prayer #PrinceofPeace
item.description: Prayer is how we tell our Heavenly Father the blessings we desire and express our gratitude for what He has given us. As we pray in the name of Jesus Christ, we can receive answers to our prayers—including finding the peace Christ promises us.

item.title: #Hallelujah—An Easter Message about Jesus Christ
item.description: Jesus Christ took upon Himself the sins and sorrows of the world. Though he was crucified, He rose from the dead. This Easter, find out how, through Jesus Christ, we too can find new life. #Hallelujah. Learn more at FollowHim.mormon.org.

item.title: Follow Him—An Easter Message about Jesus Christ
item.description: If we follow Jesus Christ, we will find new life. If we trust Him, He will show us the way back to God. This Easter, start by discovering His life and teachings at FollowHim.mormon.org.

item.title: World’s Largest Virtual #Hallelujah Chorus
item.description: 300+ members of a world-famous choir combine with over 1,000 voices worldwide in an incredible musical tribute to Jesus Christ. Learn more and rejoice in Christ this Easter at FollowHim.mormon.org.

item.title: He Lives - Celebrate Easter Because Jesus Christ Lives
item.description: Because of the Resurrection, Jesus Christ lives. Because of Him, you can overcome sin and experience everlasting joy. Learn more about how you can discover, embrace, and share the joy of the Resurrection at helives.mormon.org.

item.title: Because of Him
item.description: Jesus is the Son of God and our Savior. Because of Him, death is conquered, our lives have meaning, and we can live with God again. http://www.mormon.org/becauseofhim

item.title: He is Risen: John the Beloved's Witness of the Resurrection
item.description: The Apostle John provides his eyewitness account of the last events in the Savior's life and his Resurrection.

item.title: Mountains to Climb
item.description: Finding faith in the Lord Jesus Christ will help us have the power to endure and overcome even the hardest trials in life.

item.title: Atonement - Not a One-Time Thing
item.description: A young man shares how with the help of his bishop, he is experiencing the blessings of the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Rescued by Christ
item.description: British falconer George O'Neill shares the story of how he was rescued by Christ.

item.title: The Miracle of the Atonement
item.description: There is no sin or transgression, pain or sorrow, which is outside of the healing power of His Atonement.

item.title: The Atonement Covers All Pain
item.description: Our great personal challenge in mortality is to become “a saint through the atonement of Christ.”

item.title: I Know That My Redeemer Lives
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “I Know That My Redeemer Lives.”

item.title: His Sacred Name—An Easter Declaration
item.description: This Easter, remember the sacred name, life, and sacrifice of our Savior, Jesus Christ.

item.title: None Were with Him
item.description: One of the great consolations of this Easter season is that because Jesus walked such a long, lonely path utterly alone, we do not have to do so.

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: My Redeemer Lives
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “My Redeemer Lives.”

item.title: Chapter 54: Jesus Is Risen
item.description: Jesus rises from the dead. He appears to Mary Magdalene and His Apostles as the resurrected Lord.

item.title: The Savior Suffers in Gethsemane
item.description: Jesus, Peter, James, and John retire to the Garden of Gethsemane. Jesus submits to the Father's will and begins to suffer for the sins and afflictions of mankind. He is then betrayed and arrested. Matthew 26:36-57

item.title: Jesus Is Laid in a Tomb
item.description: The Savior's body is taken by Joseph of Arimathea to a garden tomb. Angels appear and remove the stone from the front of the tomb. Mary and other women visit the empty tomb. Matthew 27:57-60

item.title: Jesus Is Resurrected
item.description: Peter and John find the empty tomb. Jesus, now resurrected, appears to Mary. John 20:3-18

item.title: He is Risen
item.description: Ponder what the Savior means to all humanity—and to you personally. And then share the good news. John 20:11-17

item.title: For God So Loved the World
item.description: Give thanks for the Lord Jesus Christ: His life, His atoning sacrifice, and His resurrection. John 3:16

item.title: Elder and Sister Bednar- Secular and Spiritual Learning
item.description: Elder and Sister Bednar talk about developing the desire to learn.

item.title: Elevate
item.description: A short, engaging video to invite seminary students to take their learning to a higher level by meeting new graduation requirements.

item.title: Focus on Education
item.description: The Church operates religious study programs for university and high-school age students throughout the world.

item.title: Seminary Can Change Lives
item.description: A testimony is necessary to get through the difficult teenage years. President Thomas S. Monson teaches how seminary can help you build and strengthen that testimony. "Effort is required," he says. "But it is effort you will never, ever regret."

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Aunt, and Award Winning Math Teacher
item.description: Freedom within structure. Mormon teacher Yvette Yamagata believes this helped her win the Presidential Award for Excellence in Mathematics and Science Teaching. It's also how she views life. More at www.mormon.org/yvette

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Ping Pong King, and Making My Mother Proud
item.description: Paris Thomas had a hard childhood. See how this Mormon teen came to know peace, and why he doesn't blame his circumstances, but believes they've made him a stronger person. Visit Paris' page at www.mormon.org/paris.

item.title: Standards: Education - The Glory of God Is Intelligence
item.description: Seeking learning is a lifelong pursuit and one that increases our ability to serve the Lord.

item.title: Learning with Our Hearts

item.description: Quote given by Elder Walter F. Gonzalez in the Sunday morning session on October 7, 2012.

item.title: Seek Learning: You Have a Work to Do

item.description: Statement by Mary N. Cook in the general Young Women meeting on March 24, 2012.

item.title: No Regrets
item.description: A young man from California decided between surfing and seminary—and never looked back.

item.description: (Matthew 9) The members of a family in trouble discover the Savior's power to heal physically and spiritually. Segment 2 - A test of faith.

item.title: Research the Records of African-American Ancestors with the Freedmen’s Bureau - Kimberly Freeman
item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ Kimberly Freeman discusses the value of using the Freedmen’s Bureau records to discover information about African-American ancestors. Expand your family tree with information from the Freedmen’s Bureau.

item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ Reverend Dr. Cecil L. Murray describes how to use the Freedmen’s Bureau records to tell the story of African-American heritage. Honor Juneteenth by exploring the Freedmen’s Bureau further.

item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ Ambassador Diane Watson talks about how to enrich your family history with information contained in the Freedmen’s Bureau records. Learn more about African-American genealogy to expand your family tree today.

item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ Dean Helen Easterling Williams discusses the importance of the Freemen’s Bureau records in obtaining information regarding African-American genealogy.

item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ George O. Davis shares how the Freedmen’s Bureau records can shed insights on your family’s past and demystify your own family’s history. Explore the collection of records to learn more today.

item.description: http://www.discoverfreedmen.org/ Judy Matthews emphasizes the value the Freedmen’s Bureau records have in uncovering previously unknown information about African-American heritage. Uncover information about your family history today.

Scott that "any work you do in the temple is time well spent, but receiving ordinances vicariously for one of your own ancestors will make the time in the temple more sacred." To get started finding your family members needing temple saving ordinances, visit FamilySearch.org.

item.description: Walk through video on how to use the descendancy view to find ancestors.

item.title: How To Add Photos to Your Family Tree
item.description: Walk through on how to use the Memories in Family Tree to Add photos and stories.

item.title: Share Reserved Ordinances with Family and Friends
item.description: Demonstration of steps to share a reserved name in FamilySearch.org with another family member.

item.title: Finding Our Cousins: Descendancy View
item.description: This video gives instructions on how to use the Descendancy view in Family Tree to find ancestors using the hinting feature.

item.title: FamilySearch: When Your Family Tree Is Empty!
item.description: When your Family Tree is blank, this video provides basic instructions for quickly connecting you to the records of your ancestors that exist in FamilySearch

item.title: How to Print Your Pedigree Chart
item.description: A short demonstration of how to view and print your pedigree chart.

item.title: FamilySearch: Search Tips
item.description: Use these simple tips to get started with effective family history research on FamilySearch.

item.title: Introduction to the FamilySearch Family Tree
item.description: Here are seven steps to help you become more acquainted with the new Family Tree on familysearch.org.

item.title: Working Together in Family Tree - LDS
item.description: Here are several tips to help as you work with others in Family Tree. By following these tips you can further your family history research and help others with theirs.

item.title: Access to Records at FamilySearch.org
item.description: This video explain why FamilySearch gives access to free images of records and to paid sites. It explains how they get access to historical records from archives and how they work with companies to give everyone access to those records.

item.title: Episode 1: Quick Start
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the principles of finding a record for a known ancestor using records on familysearch.org. Watch host Jessie Davis help random individuals in a local café to find records of their ancestors in just 5 minutes.

item.title: Episode 2: The Research Process
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the method that FamilySearch suggests you use when starting your family history. Watch as host Jessie Davis teaches Tom about how she got started doing her genealogy.

item.title: Episode 3: Record What you Know
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the principles of starting your genealogy by writing down what you know about your family. Watch Jessie Davis describe pedigree charts and family group records, how to record names, dates, places, and jurisdiction.

item.title: Episode 4: Learn From Family
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the principles of starting your genealogy by talking to family. Watch host Jessie Davis as she challenges two of her friends to find out about their families by contacting family via phone and email.

item.title: Episode 5: Choose an Ancestor and Question
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the principles of how to choose the best ancestor so you can successfully find them in records and why that's important.

item.title: Episode 6: Locate Where Your Ancestors Lived
item.description: In this episode you’ll learn how to use maps, atlases, and gazetteers and why knowing your ancestor's location will help you find their records.

item.title: Episode 7: Records, an introduction
item.description: In this episode of 5 Minute Genealogy you will learn about different record types and the information you will find in each.

item.title: Episode 8: Find A Record
item.description: In this episode, you will learn the principles of finding a record for an ancestor using records using online resources and FamilySearch Centers.

item.title: Episode 9: Using Indexes To Find A Record
item.description: In this episode, you will learn what an index is and how to improve your chances of finding the genealogical records you hope to find. Watch as Amy visits the family history library and gets a behind the scenes tour.

item.title: Episode 10: Using Name Variations To Find A Record
item.description: In this episode, you will learn how names change over the years and how you can use resources on the internet to identify ancestors that may have a different surname than you expect.

item.title: Episode 11: Find Help From Others Online
item.description: Learn how to use collaborative web sites such as wikis, forums, and online trees.

item.title: Episode 12: Write It Down
item.description: In this episode, learn why it’s important to keep good notes, what kind of information you should keep track of, and the best places to keep your notes.

item.title: Episode 13: Organize Your Records
item.description: In this episode you will learn how to organize the research that you have already done and establish a system to keep your future research organized.

item.title: Episode 14: Understand how records are created
item.description: In this episode, you will learn how to evaluate the information you found in records about your ancestor.

item.title: Episode 15: Share With Others
item.description: Learn why sharing your family history research is important and the best ways to share your research.

item.title: Episode 16: Completing Your Research
item.description: In this episode you will learn what to do now that you have been around the wheel of success. You will also be introduced to the help resources available from FamilySearch. Your five minute challenge is to keep going.

item.title: Episode 17: Get Help In-Person
item.description: Today you'll learn about places where you can get one-on-one help with your genealogy.

item.title: Episode 18: Get Help from Others Researching the Same Name
item.description: Learn how online researches and genealogical societies can help you connect with people who may be researching your same ancestor.

item.title: Episode 19: I Want to Interview a Living Relative
item.description: In this episode, learn the do’s and don’ts of interviewing your living relatives. Learn what not to do from Tom’s mistakes, and learn the best ways to conduct and interview from Jessie with help from her friends.

item.title: Episode 20: I Want to Learn More About Sourcing
item.description: In this episode, learn more details about sourcing your records. Learn what details you should record to help others find your sources. You will learn the quickest way to make sure that your work is remembered.

item.title: Printing Family Ordinance Cards from Home
item.description: Learn how to print your family ordinance cards using your home computer.

item.title: Indexing Guatemala Birth Records
item.description: This video will help you as you index Guatemala Birth Records.

item.title: What Gems Will You Find In This Treasure Hunt?
item.description: Two youth find a family connection while using Find A Grave.

item.title: You Can Tell a Lot About a Person From Their Headstone
item.description: A man shares some of the important information one can find on a headstone.

item.title: The Find A Grave Project
item.description: Learn how to structure this unique family history activity for any group.

item.title: Fuel the Find
item.description: These precious family discoveries are made possible by indexing. Indexing is the fuel that gives FamilySearch.org the power to connect people to their ancestors.

item.title: Stake Indexing Directors: How Well Do You Know Your Calling?
item.description: Come learn from Dennis Brimhall how you can help Church members fulfill their divinely appointed responsibility to find their ancestors and provide saving ordinances for them in the temple.

item.title: We Were Receiving Help
item.description: A returned missionary shares how skills he learned on his mission helps him to hasten the work for those on the other side of the veil.

item.title: Second Chances: A Life Touched by Family History
item.description: Indexing was a springboard for Constance to learn about the atonement, read The Book of Mormon, and be baptized into the Church. She also learned about her ancestors and has now served many of them in the temple.

item.title: Indexing Makes a Difference
item.description: Indexing is vital to family history research and helps people find and connect with their ancestors by making records searchable online.

item.title: Redeeming the Dead Redeemed Me
item.description: Stephen Jezek was able to feel the Spirit again, overcome addictions, and get baptized because of his experience indexing. Learn how family history can increase personal righteousness in your ward and stake.

item.title: Indexing is Vital
item.description: This short video demonstrates how indexing is vital to making records searchable online for temple and family history work.

item.title: I love indexing: Markus Bolte
item.description: Markus Bolte has six children and loves spending time with them whenever he can. Markus loves indexing.

item.title: One Million Names Indexed
item.description: The Sacramento, California (United States) Stake made a goal to index one million names in one month. They didn’t know what an impact it would have on the stake. View this video to see the blessings that come from indexing and family history.

item.title: I love indexing: Zhanna Bilchuck
item.description: Zhanna Bilchuck is an engineer from Kyiv. She likes to be busy and help other people. Zhanna loves indexing.

item.title: I love indexing: Mackenzie Hughes
item.description: Mackenzie Hughes is a young busy student in Chorley, England. Mackenzie loves indexing.

item.title: The Chorley Experience
item.description: The Chorley, England, stake received many blessings by participating in indexing. Watch this video to learn how indexing can increase temple and priesthood blessings in your area.

item.title: A Voice Said, "I am Not a Son"
item.description: Indexing is a monumental, spiritual work where help is given in both directions, within and beyond the veil.

item.title: FamilySearch Indexing: How It Works
item.description: This animated video gives a light-hearted, volunteer-level explanation of how indexing works and why it is important.

item.title: I Love Indexing: Kaylie Sorensen
item.description: Kaylie Sorensen talks about her family, her interests, and shares her testimony of temple and family history work. She discusses how indexing has helped her feel the Spirit in her life.

item.title: I Love Indexing: Fernando Motta
item.description: Fernando Motta talks about his family and how they like to spend time together. He shares his testimony of temple and family history work and discusses how indexing has strengthened his family.

item.title: I Love Indexing: Davi de Silva
item.description: Davi da Silva talks about his interest in basketball and shares how he joined the Church. He discusses how family history and indexing has blessed his life.

item.title: Help Index the US Immigration & Naturalization Community Project
item.description: Volunteers are indexing immigration records as part of the US Immigration & Naturalization Community Project, making over 100 million records freely searchable online so everyone with US immigrant ancestors can discover their stories. Join today!

item.title: Obituary Indexing Announcement at RootsTech 2014
item.description: Dennis Brimhall and Captain Jack Starling announce a new initiative to index obituaries on familysearch.org

item.title: The US Immigration And Naturalization Project
item.description: Volunteers with the US Immigration & Naturalization Community Project make it possible for researchers worldwide to discover the stories of their US immigrant ancestors. We've already indexed millions of records, but there's more to do. Come join!

item.title: Indexing Training: Leadership
item.description: Learn how to index through shadow leadership that will help encourage and motivate you to set goals that are meaningful to your family.

item.title: Elder and Sister Dickey – Washington DC North Mission
item.description: The Dickeys wake up each morning with the opportunity to change lives on both sides of the veil: preserving records to facilitate work for the dead and serving and sharing the gospel with the living.

item.title: "I'm a FamilySearch Missionary" Elder Marco Fernandes
item.description: Elder Marco Fernandes from Sao Paulo, Brazil explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary.

item.title: Record Preservation Missionary in Peru
item.description: You can be like Brother and Sister Valientas, preservation missionaries in your own stake.

item.title: International Service Opportunities for Records Preservation Senior Missionaries
item.description: Would you like to serve a mission in a foreign country? Watch missionaries digitizing genealogical records at an Archive in Peru. Learn from their missionary experience.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary - Sister Irene Tolley
item.description: Sister Irene Tolley from Cardston, Alberta, Canada explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary - Elder David Redd
item.description: Elder David Redd from Cardston, Alberta, Canada explains what it is like to be a FamilySearch missionary serving from home.

item.title: FamilySearch Records Preservation Missionaries
item.description: Is this missionary experience for you? Watch missionaries digitizing genealogical records in archives domestically and internationally. Learn from their missionary experience.

item.title: I'm a FamilySearch Missionary-Elder and Sister Busker
item.description: Elder David Busker and Sister Leora Busker share how serving as FamilySearch missionaries has strengthened them as a couple and revitalized their lives.

item.title: A Day in the Life of a FamilySearch Missionary-Elder Allen Forsyth
item.description: What is it like to be a FamilySearch missionary? Elder Allen Forsyth explains what has helped him to be an effective missionary.

item.title: A Day in the Life of a FamilySearch Missionary in Training-Sister Queen
item.description: What is it like to be a FamilySearch missionary in training? Sister Lynnel Queen explains the training experience.

item.title: Increasing Convert Retentiion with Temple and Family History Work
item.description: Watch missionaries teach Zayna Chubbs from the booklet Families and Temples, help her find family names, add them to FamilySearch.org, print out ordinance cards, and take the ancestors' names to the temple for proxy baptisms and confirmations.

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 1
item.description: Watch the story of Zayna Chubbs, a recent convert, prepare to attend the temple by learning about her family history and finding names of deceased family members.

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 2
item.description: Watch the story of Zayna Chubbs, a recent convert, prepare to attend the temple by learning about her family history and finding names of deceased family members.

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 3

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 4
item.description: Watch the story of Zayna Chubbs, a recent convert, prepare to attend the temple by learning about her family history and finding names of deceased family members.

item.title: One Work of Salvation, Part 5
item.description: Tempe, Arizona Mission President advises returning missionaries to overcome challenges and keep covenants by being involved with temple and family history service.

item.title: Missionaries More Fully Converted

item.title: They Wanted to Go Back
item.description: As new converts attend the temple to do baptisms for their own family, they feel the Spirit, their testimonies are strengthened, and they become truly converted.

item.description: A convert who lost his mother in a car accident explains how the message of eternal families led him to be baptized so that he could do the temple work for his mother.

item.title: Just One Word: Family
item.description: A husband and wife, who recently returned to Church activity, describe the peace and happiness they felt in doing baptisms for their ancestors and being sealed together as a family.

item.title: And There's Temples On It!
item.description: A husband and wife, who recently returned to Church activity, describe the joy of sharing the gospel on both sides of the veil, and the blessings of becoming an eternal family.

item.title: It Helped Me Go On a Mission
item.description: Young people describe how their involvement in family history and temple work strengthened their testimonies of the gospel and prepared them for full-time missionary service.

item.title: I Want to Enter the Temple
item.description: An investigator attends Sacrament meeting for the first time and is so touched by the Spirit that she wants to enter the temple as soon as possible.

item.title: And Now I'm Going to Be Baptized
item.description: A widow describes how learning the doctrine of family history and temple work provided the hope that prepared her for baptism and led to her sealing in the temple.

item.title: I Couldn’t Explain the Feeling
item.description: A convert to the Church tells how doing family history research helped her to feel the Spirit and prepared her heart to receive the gospel message.

item.description: Missionaries describe how they can use family history in their missionary efforts.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Finding
item.description: Full-time missionaries using family history in their efforts to find people to teach.

item.title: Family History and Missionary Work-Retention
item.description: Full-time missionaries using temple and family history work in their convert retention efforts.

item.description: Full-time missionaries using temple and family history work in their activation efforts.

item.title: Strengthen Families: Jess Family Condensed
item.description: The story of the Jess Family and how family history and temple work brought them closer together. - Condensed

item.title: Activation: Paul Felix
item.description: Paul Felix became an Elder before entering the Air Force. After getting married he always thought his wife would join the church. Now after years of inactivity and the passing of his wife he is coming back to church and going to the temple.

item.title: Missionary Work And Retention: Georgia Elias
item.description: Georgia Elias is converted to the gospel through family history work and begins her journey to the temple.

item.title: New Members And Retention: Dauphinee Family
item.description: After getting married and starting a family, Michael Dauphinee and his wife Jessica felt the need to go to church. See how family history has helped them grow in the gospel.

item.title: Make the Sabbath a Delight by Finding Your Ancestors
item.description: Family history is one of the many things we can do to observe and find delight on the Sabbath day.

item.title: Help Others Add Photos and Documents to Their Family Tree
item.description: Use your knowledge to help others with their family history. As you serve your testimony of family history will be strengthened.

item.title: Help Others Find Records by Indexing
item.description: We are here to participate in the work of salvation in inviting all of these people to come unto Christ and receive the saving ordinances of the gospel.

item.title: Help Others Come Back to Church
item.description: Inviting others to do family history is a non-threatening way to help them feel the spirit and to give them motivation to visit the temple with the names that they find through their family history.

item.title: Help New Members Take a Name to the Temple
item.description: You can help new members feel that same spirit by becoming comfortable with finding ancestors and taking their names to the temple to do ordinances for them.

item.title: Help the Families You Home Teach
item.description: Sharing your family history with those you home teach is a great way to stay involved in planning and teaching.

item.title: Family History: Not a Program of the Church, But a Principle of the Gospel
item.description: Family History: Not a Program of the Church, But a Principle of the Gospel

item.title: FamilySearch Records Preservation: Niue Island
item.description: FamilySearch helped prevent the loss of public land, marriage, and other historical records by archiving these records before a major hurricane struck Niue Island.

item.title: All the Reasons We Love Dad
item.description: Dear Dad: Here are just a few of the countless reasons we’re so glad you’re ours. Thanks for being our teacher, our support, and our friend. Happy Father’s Day.

item.title: A Father’s Love: A Father’s Day Tribute to Fathers
item.description: This Father’s Day, let us give thanks for the innumerable blessings we’ve received from both our earthly fathers and our Heavenly Father. Celebrate Father’s Day and visit fatherhood.mormon.org to see why fathers matter.

item.title: Earthly Father, Heavenly Father
item.description: Men on earth have the opportunity to become fathers and experience some of the same joys that our Heavenly Father feels for us. Fatherhood is a divine responsibility to be cherished.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Broadcaster, and Single Father
item.description: Vicente Hernandez loves broadcasting the news in his strong, deep voice. His own strength comes from the knowledge that he is not alone, even during the greatest trial of his life. See photos at www.mormon.org/vicente

item.title: Love Her Mother
item.description: How can a father raise a happy, well-adjusted daughter in today's increasingly toxic world?

item.title: Today's Family: Fathers
item.description: Quotes from several members of the First Presidency and the Twelve about the role and importance of fathers.

item.title: Fathers and Sons
item.description: A young man in Nevada applied the counsel given by Elder M. Russell Ballard of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles and changed his relationship with his father forever.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Polynesian Father, and Former NFL Player
item.description: NFL player Gabe Reid thought about giving up, but persevered and played with the Chicago Bears and the Tennessee Titans. Now this Mormon father of four teaches his kids to never quit. Read more at www.mormon.org/gabe

item.title: A Son Every Day
item.description: A new father is touched by an act of service provided by his own father.

item.title: Home Repair
item.description: A father is busy working on a special project at home.

item.title: Fathers
item.description: Father's Day video featuring photos and music members have shared with the LDS Church.

item.title: Secret Agent
item.description: A father plays hide-and-seek with his son.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Single Dad, Designer, Baseball Coach
item.description: Robert Comstock is a New York fashion designer who wanted to leave his mark on the world. Now, a single Mormon father, he sees his greatest creations aren't the clothes, but his sons. See more at www.mormon.org/robert

item.title: Bad Hair Day
item.description: A father stays home from bowling night to play with his daugthers.

item.title: Dry Cleaner
item.description: A father counsels his son after he loses his job.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, an Osteopath, and a Loving Dad
item.description: As an Osteopath, Michael Pye helps relieve physical pain in others. His faith in the gospel of Jesus Christ helps him to know that God can ease all burdens. www.mormon.org/michael

item.title: Phone Call
item.description: A father calls his daughter just to say hi.

item.title: A Father Indeed
item.description: The story of a committed husband and father who consistently and passionately demonstrates his love and devotion to his wife and kids.

item.title: Father's Day
item.description: This non-denominational video message for Father's Day has been produced in association with several faith groups to remind people everywhere of the importance of families.

item.title: Saturday Mornings
item.description: A dad gets to know his daughters by listening.

item.title: Waiting for Dad
item.description: A daughter waits for her father while he is on the phone.

item.title: Daddy’s Sunshine
item.description: Marissa Widdison, “Daddy’s Sunshine,” Friend, Mar. 2009, 34–35 (Based on a true story) For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also (Matthew 6:21).

item.title: Search for Truth—Isaiah
item.description: Isaiah testifies that an understanding of the truth comes after fasting and praying.

item.title: Chapter 11: Jesus Is Tempted
item.description: The devil comes to Jesus as he is fasting and tempts him three times.

item.title: Chapter 47: Jesus Christ Blesses His Disciples
item.description: Christ comes to the twelve disciples when they are fasting and praying. He teaches them the gospel and tells them to write down his words. He promises each of the Twelve distinct blessings.

item.title: Wherefore Have We Fasted
item.description: (Isaiah 58) A young man recounts a lesson learned from his youth.

item.description: A short clip from the Jerry Foote Family video showing the benefits of the fast offering and how it can help those who are in need.

item.title: Having the Vision to Do

item.description: President Monson expresses the importance of gratitude in everyday life.

item.title: Come, Ye Thankful People

item.title: In the Spirit of Thanksgiving
item.description: Random people on the streets of New York City share a variety of grateful responses to one simple question: What are you thankful for?

item.title: Consider the Blessings
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Sunday morning session on October 7, 2012.

item.title: Elder Hales Talks about Gratitude
item.description: Elder Hales stressed that we should never forget to thank Heavenly Father for the blessings, gifts, and talents He has given to us.

item.title: Highlight: Grateful in Any Circumstances—Dieter F. Uchtdorf

item.description: William R. Walker encourages Latter-day Saints to live true to the faith, honoring the legacy of their faithful ancestors.

Bednar discusses how to discern and act upon light from God. View Part 1, Patterns of Light: The Light of Christ View Part 3, Patterns of Light: Spirit of Revelation

item.description: President Boyd K. Packer shares an experience in which he was protected during World War II by listening to a prompting from the Spirit and promises youth that they will be protected if they "heed the promptings that come from the Holy Ghost."

item.title: Having the Holy Ghost
item.description: You can invite the Holy Spirit into your life through prayer, scripture study and being obedient to God’s commandments.

item.title: Feeling the Holy Ghost
item.description: Feelings of the Holy Spirit can be likened to hope, joy and peace in your heart and mind.

item.title: Increase Your Testimony
item.description: Strengthen your testimony of God and His teachings by recognizing the feelings of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Receiving Revelation
item.description: You can receive personal revelation from God by living His gospel and having the gift of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Guided by the Holy Spirit
item.description: Every one of us can be guided by the spirit of revelation and the gift of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: Voice of the Spirit
item.description: In a world full of noise and many voices, President James E. Faust invites us to listen to and follow the voice of the Spirit, which is calm and quiet and leads to eternal life.

item.title: Guided Safely Home
item.description: Highlight of President Thomas S. Monson's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar
item.description: Face to Face with Elder and Sister Bednar

item.title: Do What Is Right
item.description: The choir and congregation sing “Do What Is Right.”

item.title: Nephi Proves His Innocence
item.description: (Helaman 1–12) The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people’s wickedness. Segment 3, Nephi Proves His Innocence.

item.title: Oh Say, What Is Truth?
item.description: The Mormon Tabernacle Choir sings “Oh Say, What Is Truth?”

item.title: Ananias And Sapphira
item.description: (Acts 5:1-11) Neal A. Maxwell speaks about lying.

item.title: Honesty: You Better Believe It!
item.description: It is better to be honest than get a good score on a test.

item.title: Be Honest
item.description: Quote given by Sister Ann M. Dibb in the general Young Women meeting on March 26, 2011.

item.title: Stay in the Boat and Hold on!
item.description: The Lord has provided help, including a boat and essential supplies such as life jackets, and experienced river guides to help us make our way down the river of life to our final destination.

item.title: A Mother's Hope
item.description: When President Uchtdorf was a young child, he learned that his mother was a great example of how hope and faith can overcome fear.

item.title: Hope Leads
item.description: (Moroni 10:20–23) President Dieter F. Uchtdorf talks about hope.

item.title: Miracles
item.description: (Mark 1:23; 2:12) President Harold B. Lee says the greatest miracles today are "the healing of sick souls."

item.title: God Will Lift Us Up
item.description: Rather than focus on her medical condition, Brittany has found comfort in serving others and trusting in the Lord.

item.title: Hope
item.description: Our hope in the Atonement empowers us with eternal perspective.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Single Mother, and Special Needs Advocate
item.description: Even as a single parent, Anne Row is a Mormon mother who turns her hardships into courage, faith, and love for others. See more about Anne at www.mormon.org/anne

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Addict Caretaker, and Voice for the Homeless
item.description: Sally Marks draws upon Christ-like empathy to help the homeless and those recovering from addiction. She's a Mormon who sees herself as a voice for those whom society can't hear. Read more at www.mormon.org/sally

item.title: Good Things to Come
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland recalls his days as a poor young father with a broken-down family car and testifies that for those who embrace the gospel of Jesus Christ, there are better days and good things to come.

item.title: Lifting Burdens
item.description: Apostles of Jesus Christ testify of the Savior's power to heal, change, and purify us through His Atonement.

item.title: The Power of Hope
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf, an Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, shares how hope encourages and inspires us to place our trust in the loving care of our Heavenly Father and His Son, Jesus Christ.

item.title: Finding Hope
item.description: A man describes his journey from the tragedy and trauma of 9/11 to hope, healing, and renewal through Jesus Christ.

item.title: You're Never Alone
item.description: A disciple of Jesus Christ, Elaine S. Dalton, describes how a grueling marathon taught her about prayer and the strength we can receive from God.

item.title: Hope Ya Know, We Had a Hard Time
item.description: Elder Quentin L. Cook testifies that the Atonement of Jesus Christ can help us pass through the challenges and trials of this life with hope and assurance in God's love for us.

item.title: The Reason for Our Hope
item.description: Highlight of President Boyd K. Packer's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Choose to Be Humble
item.description: (1 Samuel 15:10-35) President Hinckley encourages church member to choose to be humble.

item.title: Our Hands, His Hands; Our Hearts, His Heart

item.title: Jesus Teaches that We Must Become as Little Children
item.description: Those who humble themselves as little children are the greatest in the kingdom of heaven. Matthew 18:1-11; Mark 9:38-42

item.title: "If They Harden Not Their Hearts"
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

item.title: Chapter 39: Nephi Receives Great Power
item.description: Nephi is saddened by the wickedness of the Nephites. He prays for a famine to humble them.

item.title: Five Loaves and Two Fishes
item.description: (Mark 6:32–44) President James E. Faust shares how the humble, everyday actions of typical members of the Church is equal to the miracle of the loaves and fishes. An excerpt from “Five Loaves and Two Fishes,” Ensign, May 1994.

item.title: Heber J. Grant: Documentary
item.description: A documentary of Heber J. Grant that teaches his humility in serving to benefit the welfare of others.

item.title: He Teaches Us to Put Off the Natural Man
item.description: I bear witness of the reality and power of the Savior’s Atonement to cleanse, purify, and make us and our homes holy.

item.title: “Lord, I Believe”
item.description: Honestly acknowledge your questions and your concerns, but first and forever fan the flame of your faith, because all things are possible to them that believe.

item.title: Called of Him to Declare His Word
item.description: If you are humble and obedient and hearken to the voice of the Spirit, you will find great happiness in your service as a missionary.

item.title: Beware of Pride
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson delivers a message titled "Beware of Pride"

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: We Have Kept the Faith
item.description: Eduardo Ayala delivers a message titled "We Have Kept the Faith."

item.title: Faith, Devotion, and Gratitude
item.description: I hope that we have grateful hearts for the knowledge that we have and the testimonies we have and for the feelings we have.

item.title: “To Walk Humbly with Thy God”
item.description: True humility will inevitably lead us to say to God, “Thy will be done.”

item.title: Retaining a Remission of Sin
item.description: King Benjamin taught three basic principles that can help us retain a remission of our sins: first, to remain humble; second, to call upon the Lord daily; and third, to stand steadfast in the faith.

item.title: An Humble and a Contrite Heart
item.description: If we have drawn nearer to the Savior, with a more firm resolution to follow His teachings and His example, then this conference will have been a wonderful success.

item.title: Our True Identity
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf retells the story of the ugly duckling and urges us to reflect on who we really are—sons and daughters of a glorious Heavenly Father.

item.title: God's Greatest Creation
item.description: As children of God, we are His greatest creation. "Anyone who studies the workings of the human body has surely seen God moving in His majesty and power." -Elder Russell M. Nelson

item.title: Sugar Beets and the Worth of a Soul
item.description: President Monson describes how to reach out to less-active young women.

item.title: Deep Beauty
item.description: Sister Elaine S. Dalton tells of how she learned as a young woman what true beauty means. As a young woman, you were born to be a queen.

item.title: Face to Face with Lindsey Stirling
item.description: Participate in a live event featuring Lindsey Stirling, a returned missionary and world-famous entertainer. For more information on the Lindsey Stirling event, click here.

item.title: Elder and Sister Bednar- Self Esteem
item.description: Elder and Sister Bednar discuss individual worth and understanding who we are.

item.title: Judgment
item.description: A girl shares her feelings about judgment and the true individual worth of each of us.

item.title: Fragile
item.description: “Remember what you are worth.” That is the simple yet powerful message of the 2015 mutual theme song, “Fragile.” We must be kind to others, and when we ourselves are hurt we must turn to Jesus Christ, who knows and loves us always.

item.title: Your Potential, Your Privileges
item.description: President Dieter F. Uchtdorf shares a humorous parable of a man who realizes he has been living far beneath his privileges.

item.title: He Loves Us
item.description: God loves and helps our families.

item.title: Divine Potential
item.description: Becoming like Heavenly Father requires overcoming difficult times.

item.title: Eyes to See and Ears to Hear
item.description: As we keep the commandments we will have eyes to see and ears to hear and we will build the kingdom of God. Read Elder Clark's full conference talk.

item.title: Who Is Jesus Christ? A 60-Second Overview
item.description: This animation gives a short but poignant portrait of Jesus Christ and His relevance to each of us.

item.title: Jesus Christ's Church
item.description: The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints is the complete Restoration of Jesus Christ’s original Church on earth.

item.title: Suffer the Little Children to Come unto Me
item.description: Jesus invites little children to come unto Him, and teaches how to gain eternal life. Luke 18:15-17

item.title: Following God
item.description: Following God is how we find lasting happiness in this life and salvation in the next.

item.description: Mary and Joseph take Jesus to the temple, where the righteous Simeon blesses the baby and rejoices that the Lord let him live to see this day. Luke 2:22-38

item.description: The angel Gabriel announces the birth of Jesus to the shepherds. The shepherds then visit Mary, Joseph, and the newborn Jesus. Luke 2:8-18

item.title: The Greatest Gift
item.description: On Christmas morning, amid presents and torn wrappings, a young man gets a reminder of the greatest gift of all.

item.title: He Lives: Testimonies of Jesus Christ
item.description: See and hear modern-day Apostles testify that Jesus Christ is the Savior and that He lives today.

item.title: The Only True God and Jesus Christ Whom He Has Sent
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland testifies of the Savior and what it means to be Christian.

item.title: Young Jesus Teaches in the Temple
item.description: Mary and Joseph find Jesus about His father's business, teaching in the temple. Luke 2:40-52

item.title: Highlight: "I Have Given You an Example"—Richard G. Scott
item.description: Richard G. Scott explains how we can follow the Savior's example and be a loving influence for good in the lives of others.

item.title: Highlight: Christ the Redeemer—Carlos H. Amado
item.description: Carlos H. Amado testifies that all who have lived or will live on earth are blessed by the Atonement of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Which Way Do You Face?
item.description: Highlight of Elder Lynn G. Robbins's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Ponder the Path of Thy Feet
item.description: Highlight of President Thomas S. Monson's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Ask of God: Joseph Smith's First Vision

item.title: Joseph Smith's First Vision
item.description: Depiction of Joseph Smith's First Vision.

item.title: Joseph Smith: The Prophet of the Restoration (DVD Release)

item.title: The Message of the Restoration
item.description: Declare to the world that the fullness of the gospel of Jesus Christ was restored to the earth.

item.title: Your Witness of the Prophet Joseph Smith
item.description: A personal testimony of the Prophet Joseph Smith will prepare you to help others who are seeking the truth.

item.title: Testimony of Joseph Smith

item.description: As an answer to a fervent prayer, Joseph Smith sees God the Father and Jesus Christ.
