item.description: Joseph teaches that the Book of Mormon is the most correct book on earth.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: Sealed His Testimony with His Blood
item.description: Joseph Smith dies in Carthage Jail, a martyr for the cause of the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: Temples
item.description: Joseph Smith establishes temple work as an essential purpose for the Saints of God.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: The Restoration of Priesthood Authority
item.description: Priesthood authority is given to Joseph Smith by the Apostles Peter, James, and John.

item.title: Ministry of Joseph Smith: The Organization of the Church
item.description: Joseph teaches that the organization of the Church is the same today as in ancient times.

item.description: Church members describe in their own words Joseph Smith's search for truth.

item.title: Joseph Smith
item.description: Elder Neil L. Andersen's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Joseph Smith Was a Prophet part 1
item.description: President Monson shares a story of two missionaries in Canada bearing their testimony of the Prophet Joseph Smith. Part 1

item.title: Joseph Smith Was a Prophet part 2
item.description: President Monson shares a story of two missionaries in Canada bearing their testimony of the Prophet Joseph Smith. Part 2

item.title: A Seer Will I Raise Up
item.description: (JST, Genesis 50) Joseph Smith is prepared to bring to pass the restoration of the Gospel.

item.title: Those Who Knew Joseph Best
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about those who knew Joseph best (D&C 135).

item.title: The First Vision
item.description: President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches about the First Vision

item.title: Joseph Smith and the First Vision
item.description: Story from the paper of the prophet Joseph Smith featuring Mark Ashurst-McGee: Joseph and the First Vision.

item.title: The Kingdom of Heaven
item.description: The kingdom of heaven consists of the just separated out from the wicked. Matt 13:44-51

item.title: Be Ye Therefore Perfect
item.description: (3 Nephi 12:48) Elder Joseph B. Wirthlin speaks of the charge to become perfect like the Savior.

item.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
item.description: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become “kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving.”

item.title: The Merciful Obtain Mercy
item.description: When our hearts are filled with the love of God, we become “kind one to another, tenderhearted, forgiving.”

item.title: Judging Others? Stop It!
item.description: Statement by President Dieter F. Uchtdorf in the Sunday morning session on April 1, 2012.

item.title: Looking through Windows
item.description: We should be careful how we judge others, as we may be looking at them through our own "unclean windows." Read President Monson's full address, "Charity Never Faileth".

item.title: The Civility Experiment
item.description: Learn how civility and kindness go much deeper than appearances and quick judgments. Read President Thomas S. Monson’s full address, “Charity Never Faileth.”

item.title: Judgment
item.description: A girl shares her feelings about judgment and the true individual worth of each of us.

item.title: What Manner of Men and Women Ought Ye to Be?
item.description: November 2, 2008: Bishop H. David Burton speaks about what constitutes true success in life.

item.title: Like a Broken Vessel
item.description: For personal accounts of living with mental illness, answers to common questions, and other resources, visit http://mentalhealth.lds.org

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.description: (D&C 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lord's to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Hard Work, Sacrifice, Obedience
item.description: Brigham Young describes the blessings that come from faithfully facing life's challenges.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?

item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.description: A World War II fighter pilot teaches youth some essential truths to fly by—and to live by.

item.title: President Henry B. Eyring Testifies of Jesus Christ
item.description: President Eyring teaches that the Savior is mindful of us and will guide us through life’s trials.

item.title: Courage
item.description: Learn from the life of Esther and other inspiring women the importance of trusting in God and courageously standing up for what you believe.

item.description: With God’s help, our homes and hearts can be filled with love.

item.title: As I Have Loved You

item.title: How Do I Love Thee?
item.description: Elder Holland gives a powerful talk about how you can better show love for your friends, family, dates or spouse by following the example of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Marry the Right Person - Veme
item.description: "If you marry the right person at the right time and in the right place, you need not fear."—M. Russell Ballard

item.title: Highlight: Love—the Essence of the Gospel—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others' lives.

item.title: A Pure Love Story
item.description: Though the Lynns’ life is still quite different than most, Jenny and Mark have allowed this tragedy to strengthen their commitment and love for each other.

item.description: A thought from Bonnie L. Oscarson, Young Women general president, about the joy of sharing the gospel with others.

item.title: Highlight: “Where Justice, Love, and Mercy Meet”
item.description: Highlight: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland’s address at the April 2015 General Conference.

item.description: (Moroni 7:44-48) Charity is not an act, or state of being. It is something we become.

item.description: "Love is the very essence of the gospel, the noblest attribute of the human soul. Love is the remedy for ailing families, ill communities, and sick nations." —Thomas S. Monson

item.description: For personal accounts of living with mental illness, answers to common questions, and other resources, visit http://mentalhealth.lds.org

item.title: Living with Depression
item.description: When Heather first recognized the symptoms of her depression, she felt ashamed. She also felt sure that with faith, prayer, and help from Jesus Christ, the depression could be taken away. She learned that prayers are answered in unexpected ways.

item.title: Living Beyond “What If?” | Cambry Kaylor
item.description: Cambry Kaylor was a promising equestrian vaulter with dreams of competing internationally. At age 18 she suffered an accident while vaulting, leaving her a paraplegic, but that didn’t stop her from achieving her dreams.

item.title: Alan's Story
item.description: As a young bishop Alan thought a healthy lifestyle coupled with strong religious habits could “fix” depression. After experiencing it for himself he develops a deeper understanding of mental illness.

item.title: Alek's Story
item.description: Alek struggled during high school and on his mission with depression and anxiety. It was the love of his family that helped him see how he could apply the Atonement of Jesus Christ and find hope.

item.title: Bethany’s Story
item.description: She began to experience health issues and intense feelings of fear and sadness as a youth. When she finally decided to reach out for help and treatment, she found the courage to keep going and keep trying.

item.title: Brent's Story
item.description: As a counselor, Brent has helped many people learn to live with different challenges, including diagnosed mental illnesses. Listen as Brent shares his insight and suggestions on understanding and supporting a loved one who is struggling.

item.title: Cassidy's Story
item.description: At 16, Cassidy began to experience symptoms of bipolar disorder. She hid her struggles, restricted her food intake, and self-harmed as she struggled to understand what was happening and regain control.

item.title: Craig’s Story
item.description: Craig is an athlete, business owner, and father with depression and anxiety. He struggled to feel the Spirit and felt out of place at Church. After attempting suicide, he got the help he needed.

item.title: Emily’s Story
item.description: Emily was an independent young adult when depression changed her life. She lost her faith, questioned love and spent days in bed, crying and sleeping. Emily talks about the process she’s gone through to find relief and hope again.

item.title: Jelena's Story
item.description: Jelena developed depression and post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) after being assaulted. She noticed personality changes and struggled to maintain relationships. Learn how she began to heal.

item.title: Jenny's Story
item.description: After joining the Church, her depression weighed more heavily. Jenny describes the challenge she faced in learning to trust God, find the strength to keep going and accept a different perspective on life.

item.title: Jesslyn's Story
item.description: Jesslyn was sure that her depression was a result of sin so she tried to serve others and study her scriptures more to make up for it. See how she found hope to hold on through her emotional pain.

item.title: Kayrena's Story
item.description: Kayrena felt alone and isolated because of her depression. Learn about the process she continues to go through to find comfort, peace and acceptance.

item.title: Kitengie's Story
item.description: Kitengie was abused as a child and often felt rejected. When she began experiencing symptoms of bipolar disorder and depression, she found hope and strength in her relationship with Jesus Christ.

item.title: Lisa's Story
item.description: Lisa worried that a diagnosis of bipolar disorder would cause people to see or treat her differently. When she determined to find herself again, she found a source of comfort and learned that she didn’t have to be a victim of her illness.

item.title: Marie's Story
item.description: Marie was abused as a teenager and often felt alone. She tried to forget her past but she blamed herself for what happened and it was hard to feel happy. Learn how "giving back" has made a difference.

item.title: Mark's Story
item.description: Mark has struggled with depression most of his life. When he determined to accept God’s help and do whatever He asked, he learned that he is not an exception to the Atonement.

item.title: Melinda's Story
item.description: Melinda shares her personal struggle with postpartum depression and how she managed her grief after losing her husband by suicide.

item.title: Regi's Story
item.description: Regi felt hopeless for most of her life, did not get along with others and struggled to keep a job. When she felt ready to give up, she found someone waiting to help.

item.title: Renee's Story
item.description: Renee often used humor as a mask to hide her depression after an abusive childhood. She shares her story to help others know that God loves us and our spirits can not be broken.

item.title: Ryan's Story
item.description: Ryan struggled to manage manic depression on his own and eventually sought help at his family's encouragement. Learn how he finds hope and peace through his family and in Christ.

item.title: Sheina's Story
item.description: Sheina felt trapped by her depression. She convinced herself that suicide was the only way to end her pain. Listen to Sheina’s story of recovery and faith through ongoing challenges.

item.title: Sheryl's Story
item.description: Sheryl struggled with depression and bipolar disorder throughout her life and often wondered what her purpose in this life was. She had a moment of clarity in which she was able to find strength through the thought of her children’s futures.

item.title: Elder Holland’s Counsel for Early Returned Missionaries
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland addresses concerns from early returned missionaries prior to the March 2016 Face to Face event.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Cook
item.description: Elder Cook shares the history of missionary work and bears his apostolic testimony of the work.

item.title: Unto All The World: Hastening the Work in Europe
item.description: Elder Ballard and Elder Oaks of the Quorum of the Twelve Apostles visit Europe to help an influx of new missionaries hasten the work of salvation.

item.title: Unto All The World: Jean Collin's Story
item.description: Elder M. Russell Ballard's testimony that “every living soul is precious” is illustrated by the conversion story of a man from Paris, France.

item.title: Sugar Beets and the Worth of a Soul
item.description: President Monson describes how to reach out to less-active young women.

item.title: A Priesthood Duty
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson speaks to young people about missionary service—a duty for young men and a rewarding option for young women.

item.title: Same Jersey
item.description: It’s Friday night—the big rivalry game between two Arizona high school football teams. The quarterbacks are opponents tonight, and tomorrow one of them will baptize the other into the Church of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Mormon Missionaries
item.description: A glimpse into the life of a missionary of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Professional Rugby Player, and Missionary
item.description: At age 19, Will Hopoate is a professional rugby player. He will soon be a Mormon missionary and sees it as a chance to thank God for his blessings. View Will’s video portrait at www.mormon.org/william.

item.title: From Rugby Pitch to Mission Field
item.description: Quote given by Elder Neil L. Andersen in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: 6 Brothers
item.description: A family of six boys shares how missionary work has become a part of their daily lives.

item.title: Value of a Full-Time Mission
item.description: Missionaries from around the world share their testimonies of blessings received from choosing to serve a mission.

item.title: Why Mormons send missionaries around the world
item.description: Mormons send missionaries to help others and to share the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Cape Verde, Land of Light
item.description: A brief history celebrating the growth of the Church in Cabo Verde leading up to the formation of the first stake in the region. Former missionaries and natives of Cabo Verde all share their experiences of church growth.

item.title: Your Day for a Mission
item.description: At 19, Sid Going was a shoo-in for New Zealand's national rugby team, but he chose to serve a mission first. Elder Neil L. Andersen tells why Sid made the decision and how the blessings of a mission outweigh any sacrifice.

item.title: Sharing Your Beliefs
item.description: Use blogging, texting, and other forms of communication to share your testimony of the gospel to all the world.

item.title: Without Fear
item.description: An Italian missionary suffering from diabetes recounts how he didn't serve his mission until he received his patriarchal blessing.

item.title: Ask the Missionaries! They Can Help You!
item.description: All missionaries, younger and older, serve with the sole hope of making life better for other people.

item.title: Missionaries Are a Treasure of the Church
item.description: I am thankful that missionaries are called by the Lord, that they respond to that call, and that they are serving throughout the world.

item.title: The Opportunity of a Lifetime
item.description: Through your devoted service and willing sacrifice, your mission will become holy ground to you.

item.title: We Are All Enlisted
item.description: From every man, young and old, who bears the priesthood, I ask for a stronger and more devoted voice, … a voice for good, a voice for the gospel, a voice for God.

item.title: Rescue in Unity
item.description: Highlight of Elder Chi Hong Wong's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Come And See
item.description: Highlight of Elder David A. Bednar's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Elder and Sister Bednar- Missionary Working Life
item.description: Elder and Sister Bednar talk about service and how to prepare for missionary life.

item.title: A Work of Love
item.description: A thought from Bonnie L. Oscarson, Young Women general president, about the joy of sharing the gospel with others.

item.title: Help Make a Mother’s Day Beautiful
item.description: Many mothers around the world face challenges they cannot solve themselves. LDS Charities helps mothers overcome those challenges so they can focus on what matters most—being a mom.

item.title: Make a Mother's Day Happy
item.description: Join us to see how much time we can give back to mom’s within 48 hours. Share your moments using the #TimeForMom and we will count the hours you are giving to make a mother’s day happy. Visit Mormon Channel for more info on how to make a Mother's Day Happy

item.title: To Every Mother
item.description: A tribute to all of the mothers in our lives; those we know, and those who came before. We are who we are largely because of our mother. Honor your mother by preserving the memories of her on familysearch.org.

item.title: It Was Mom: A Mother’s Day Tribute To Moms
item.description: Mother’s Day celebrates moms who gave us life and taught us how to live. This Mother’s Day visit motherhood.mormon.org to see why motherhood has been deemed the highest, holiest calling in the world.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Mom of Two Autistic Boys, and a Teacher
item.description: Mormon Michelle Paniagua is not just a bilingual teacher. She’s also a mom of two autistic boys with special challenges of their own. See how faith guides her life at www.mormon.org/michelle

item.title: A Mother's Hope
item.description: When President Uchtdorf was a young child, he learned that his mother was a great example of how hope and faith can overcome fear.

item.title: Mary, the Mother of Jesus
item.description: Mary was highly favored of God and chosen to be the mother of Jesus Christ. Her humility, devotion, and strength stand as a model for all Christian disciples. Luke 1:26-35

item.title: Love Her Mother
item.description: How can a father raise a happy, well-adjusted daughter in today's increasingly toxic world?

item.title: An Angel Foretells Christ’s Birth to Mary
item.description: The angel Gabriel, sent from the presence of God, announces to the young Mary her future role as the mother of the child Jesus. Luke 1:26-38

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Spanish Newscaster
item.description: For Spaniard Irene and her husband, the best financial solution after their son was born was for Irene to keep working as a producer and anchor at a Spanish language daily newscast. Read more at www.mormon.org/Irene

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Parisian, and Mother of 7
item.description: Nadja Pettitt speaks a half-dozen languages, lives in Paris, and when she's not busy raising seven kids, she runs her own business. It's her own way of raising a happy Mormon family. See more at www.mormon.org/nadja

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Devoted Mother, and Avid Photographer
item.description: Shawni Pothier admits that motherhood is an experiment and her parenting strategies work about half the time. Still, she 's a Mormon mother who finds joy in capturing precious moments. See Shawni at www.mormon.org/shawni

item.title: I'm a Mormon, a Mother, and Finnish Born Photographer
item.description: For Beatta Bosworth, home is where you make memories with the people you love. This Mormon mother is doing just that, and uses photography to stay in touch with her own Finnish home. See more at www.mormon.org/beatta

item.title: I’m a Mormon, Texan, and Mother of Two Disabled Sons
item.description: Rochelle Tallmadge is a Mormon mom of four. Two of her boys have special needs. See why she believes they're here to bring love to the world and teach the rest of us compassion. See more at www.mormon.org/rochelle.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Public Health Advocate and Mother of Three
item.description: Emily and Aaron Sherinian are two working Mormon parents, striving to maintain their hectic professional schedules while staying focused on their family. See more about the Sherinians at www.mormon.org/emily

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother of Three, and Joyful Artist
item.description: As a free-spirited mother, Cassandra Barney encourages her children to explore creativity in her studio. Family and career blend for this Mormon artist like the colors on her brush. See more at www.mormon.org/cassandra

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Single Mother, and Special Needs Advocate
item.description: Even as a single parent, Anne Row is a Mormon mother who turns her hardships into courage, faith, and love for others. See more about Anne at www.mormon.org/anne

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Filipino-American Artist
item.description: A talented Filipino-American artist, Rose Dall, notes her greatest life's work is not her paintings but her family. The effects of mothering, she says, will far outlast her career. Read more at www.mormon.org/rose

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Former Journalist, and Dedicated Mother
item.description: Jane Clayson Johnson once interviewed the U.S. President and anchored Good Morning America. Then this Mormon woman put her plans on hold to fulfill another lifelong dream: become a mother. See more at www.mormon.org/jane

item.title: Motherhood: An Eternal Partnership With God
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland shares an encouraging tribute to mothers who, through both challenges and accomplishments, work in partnership with God to raise His children.

item.title: Mothers and Daughters
item.description: Young women in Alberta, Canada, talk about why their mothers are such good examples for them. Elder M. Russell Ballard teaches about the blessings and importance of the special relationship between mothers and daughters.

item.title: Happy Mother's Day, Mom!
item.description: Youth wish a happy Mother's Day to the women they love and appreciate most in their lives.

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Wife of a Fallen Soldier
item.description: Mormon Vendella has two heroes. One is her husband, who was killed in Iraq. The other is Jesus Christ, through whom she believes all things are possible. She tells her story at www.mormon.org/vendella

item.title: I’m a Mormon and Mother to 79 Orphaned Children
item.description: The letter contained a single phrase: “Come, all hands are needed.” So Cécile sold her Paris home, brought her hands to Nepal, and built an orphanage. More at www.mormon.org/Cecile

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Cultural Mesh, and Self-Invented Cook
item.description: Nadia Las Deskins is a Mormon mother devoted to passing on her Persian heritage. She teaches her children Farsi, cooks her grandmother's recipes, and makes room for one more at the table. See more at www.mormon.org/nadia

item.title: This is My Mother
item.description: Family history work can help us see how we're alike.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, and Caretaker of Bulgarian Orphans
item.description: Mormon mother Deborah Gardner cares for not only her own five children, but thousands of Bulgarian orphans whose physical and emotional needs are met through her service. See more at www.mormon.org/deborah

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, Survivor and Cancer Fighter
item.description: Tessa Winger was diagnosed with Hodgkin's lymphoma at 16. Now the cancer is back. But this radiant Mormon mother of two feels the hand of God in her life. See Tessa's story at www.mormon.org/Tessa

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Mother, Grandmother, and Foster Parent
item.description: Elizabeth takes in anything to which she can offer a better life – children, animals, garage sale items. She's a Mormon set on making a difference. See more at www.mormon.org/elizabeth.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Kiwi, Mother, and Polkadot Entertainer
item.description: She’s a Polkadot. He’s a Polkadot groupie. She’s an eyebrow guru. He’s a crown prosecutor. But best of all, she’s a nutter and he adores her for it. See more on this Mormon couple at www.mormon.org/dionne.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, World Squash Champion, and Imperfect Mother
item.description: Years after conquering the game of squash, Mormon world champion Leilani Rorani learned that conquering the challenges of life, including postpartum depression, requires a different type of perfection. Visit Leilani's page at www.mormon.org/leilani.

item.title: I’m a Mormon, a Dancer, and a Mom
item.description: As a teacher, a dancer, and a mother, Leila strives to give children the love and support that she never had as a child. See more at www.mormon.org/leila

item.title: Choose the Light
item.description: A reckless biker finds himself in a battle against time and the elements when he enters a situation he can’t get out of. He discovers his only option is to choose the light.

item.title: Blessed and Happy Are Those Who Keep the Commandments of God
item.description: Just as a barrier in the ocean can prevent sharks from entering the bay, the barriers established by the Lord create for us a safe harbor from evil and destructive influences. Read Elder Keetch's full conference talk here

item.title: Obedience to the Ten Commandments
item.description: As children of God, we have been given the wonderful gift of choice. The truest happiness and peace we can have comes by choosing to obey His laws.

item.title: Follow the Prophet
item.description: Carol F. McConkie, First Counselor in the Young Women’s Presidency, describes why God calls prophets. A group of youth discover the importance of listening to the right voices when charting their course.

item.title: Will We Be Willing?
item.description: Statement by President Thomas S. Monson in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Spiritual Vertigo
item.description: A World War II fighter pilot teaches youth some essential truths to fly by—and to live by.

item.title: The Sting of the Scorpion
item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: A Secure Anchor
item.description: Just like rock climbing alone can be dangerous, living your life without the help of the Savior can have disastrous consequences.

item.title: Within Bounds
item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.title: Leave the Party
item.description: John's life may have been very different had he not had the courage to leave a party one evening in Japan.

item.title: "An Eye Single to the Glory of God"
item.description: (D&C 82:19) Elder Nelson compares our perspective and the Lord's to a pair of binoculars.

item.title: Chapter 62: Paul Obeys the Holy Ghost
item.description: Paul listens to the Holy Ghost and goes to Jerusalem, even though he knows they will put him in prison.

item.title: Cling to Gods Values
item.description: (Numbers 6:1-21) President Hinckley encourages saints to cling to God's values.

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: Obedience Brings Blessings
item.description: President Monson talks on blessings of obedience. Please give feedback on this video — Click HERE

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: Teachings of Brigham Young: Hard Work, Sacrifice, Obedience
item.description: Brigham Young describes the blessings that come from faithfully facing life's challenges.

item.title: Teachings of John Taylor: Obedience
item.description: John Taylor demonstrates obedience to God despite the world's intolerance.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Rasband
item.description: As modern pioneers, we are creating a heritage of faith for those who will follow us. How can I build upon the legacy of my ancestors? How can I be a modern pioneer? From Salt Lake City, Elder Rasband answers these questions.

item.title: Our Pioneer Legacy
item.description: Elder Oaks teaches about our pioneer legacy (D&C 136:1-11).

item.title: Pioneers
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks, Apostle of the Lord Jesus Christ, pays tribute to modern-day pioneers who faithfully follow Jesus Christ.

item.title: A Long Line of Faithful, Righteous Women
item.description: The heritage of Relief Society is not just about women who lived in the past; it is also about women all over the world today who make and keep covenants.

item.title: Zion's Camp
item.description: (D&C 105) Several events from the march of Zion's Camp show how it fulfilled the purposes of God.

item.title: Reviewing the Lessons of the Past
item.description: Are you preparing for your future? Journey with us as Elder Perry teaches us how to prepare. Read Elder Perry's full address: http://bit.ly/9Ws2qV.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Andersen
item.description: Elder Andersen speaks about the trials that the early Saints went through and bears testimony of the love of the Savior Jesus Christ.

item.title: Special Witness - Elder Cook
item.description: Elder Cook shares the history of missionary work and bears his apostolic testimony of the work.

item.title: Convenience Versus Covenants
item.description: (Matthew 19:27–29) An excerpt from “Like a Flame Unquenchable,” Ensign, May 1999, 86.

item.title: Chapter 60: The Saints Leave Nauvoo (September 1845–September 1846)
item.description: The Lord chooses Brigham Young to be the leader after Joseph Smith's death. Mobs drive the Saints out of Nauvoo. The Saints travel in very difficult circumstances.

item.title: Chapter 61: The Mormon Battalion (June 1846–July 1847)
item.description: Brigham Young encourages men to help the United States army in a war against Mexico.

item.title: Chapter 62: The Saints Establish Winter Quarters (1846–1847)
item.description: Under the guidance of Brigham Young, the Saints postpone their trek west and establish Winter Quarters.

item.title: Chapter 63: The Pioneers Go to the Salt Lake Valley (April–July 1847)
item.description: The pioneers travel from Council Bluffs to the Salt Lake Valley. They set up Winter Quarters. The Lord tells Brigham Young to divide the people into companies.

item.title: Chapter 64: The Saints in the Rocky Mountains (Beginning in July 1847)
item.description: The Saints establish homes in the Salt Lake Valley. They build temples in the West. Many members from distant lands come to be with the Saints.

item.title: What Happens after We Die?
item.description: Life after death is part of God’s plan of happiness.

item.title: What Is the Purpose of Family?
item.description: The family is the divine building block of society.

item.title: What Mormons Believe
item.description: A summary of the core beliefs and doctrines of members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: The Plan of Salvation
item.description: Heavenly Father's plan of salvation is compared to a three-act play, showing that knowledge of the plan helps us in our everyday lives.

item.title: Plan of Salvation - We’re Still a Family
item.description: A young man shares how the plan of salvation has helped him to see the blessings that can come through trials.

item.title: Our Eternal Life
item.description: We are eternal beings. We lived as spirits before we were born and we will continue to live after we die.

item.title: The Race of Life
item.description: Where did we come from? Why are we here? Where do we go after this life? No longer need these universal questions remain unanswered.

item.title: We Can Live With God Again
item.description: Our lives will not end when we die. Our future lives are determined by the way we live our lives now.

item.title: We Can Find Happiness
item.description: See the stories of three people who find happiness through the plan of salvation as taught in the gospel of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Life
item.description: This video depicts typography showing questions and answers about the purpose of life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Irene
item.description: Irene talks about the purpose of life.

item.title: What Happens When I Die?
item.description: Church members relate how we will live again after this life because of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Preparation for the Afterlife
item.description: A family talks about what keeps their family going.

item.title: Life after Death—Jean
item.description: Jean explains that there is a continuation of family and everything else in the next life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Terrence
item.description: Terrence explains how he had always felt that there had to be more than this life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Doug
item.description: Doug discusses how he found his purpose to life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Simon
item.description: Simon talks about the purpose of life in relation to God's plan for us.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Linda
item.description: Linda talks about what it's like to realize this life has purpose and meaning.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Jan
item.description: Jan talks about the purpose of life.

item.title: Purpose of Life—Isaiah
item.description: Isaiah describes how he found the purpose of life through Heavenly Father's plan.

item.title: Unto All The World: Felicity's Story
item.description: Unto All The World: Felicity's Story

item.title: Man's Search for Happiness (1964)
item.description: Answers the questions: Where did we come from? What is the purpose of life? Where do we go after death? Presents birth, life, and death in an eternal perspective. Emphasizes the importance of the family unit in God's plan.

item.title: What Should I Do When I See Pornography?
item.description: The challenges that children face today related to pornography are tremendous, but armed with the right information about what to do when they encounter it, they can successfully overcome the challenge and lead safe, happy lives.

item.title: Overcoming Pornography Addiction: The Healing Power of Jesus Christ
item.description: Pornography addiction is "a plague like we have never seen," but God knows about this and has provided an escape through the healing power of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Meet Kerri
item.description: Kerri is devastated by her husband's addiction to pornography, but finds hope and healing through the Atonement of Jesus Christ. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Meet Troy
item.description: Troy faces the reality of his addiction to pornography. Through honesty, repentance, and the healing power of the Atonement of Jesus Christ, he finds peace. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Stay within the Lines
item.description: Just as athletes must stay within lines to compete in sports, those who are called to labor in the Lord's work must stay within the lines of worthiness.

item.title: To Look Upon
item.description: (2 Samuel 11) Elder Dallin H. Oaks relates the story of King David to illustrate the dangers of pornography. See OvercomingPornography.org.

item.title: Shun Immorality
item.description: (Genesis 39:1-20) President Hinckley encourages church members to avoid the immorality we have in the world today.

item.title: Watch Your Step
item.description: See how a moment’s decision can have far-reaching consequences—for good or bad.

item.title: Twelve Steps to Recovery
item.description: Coordinators and participants in the LDS 12-step addiction recovery program share their stories and their testimonies of the program. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Better Things
item.description: Young men from the Deer Creek Ward share their testimonies about the perils of addiction. See OvercomingPornography.org

item.title: Living with Purpose and Real Intent
item.description: The gospel teaches us who we are and helps us maintain focus on our eternal purpose. Living with real intent ensures we reach the full measure of our creation.

item.title: The Hope of God's Light
item.description: Many of us have wondered if God knows us or if He even exists. Todd was someone who wasn’t surprised when he didn’t get an immediate answer to a prayer. But could God be giving us small but obvious answers? And how patient do we need to be?

item.title: Wrong Roads
item.description: When making decisions, God expects us to pray, trust, and be believing and then not give up, panic, or "jump ship" when something doesn't seem to be going right.

item.title: Heavenly Father Knows Me
item.description: After a trial of her faith, a young woman receives a witness that Heavenly Father truly does answer prayers.

item.title: President Monson talks about Prayer
item.description: In the Sunday morning session of the October 2011 general conference, President Monson speaks about the necessity of prayer.

item.title: The Privilege of Prayer
item.description: Prayer is one of the most precious gifts of God to man.

item.title: Prayer—Sue
item.description: Sue knows that when she prays, there is really someone there who hears her.

item.title: Prayer—Terrence
item.description: Terrence discusses how he knows in his heart that God exists.

item.title: Prayer—Yvonne
item.description: Yvonne explains that we need to pray to God every day if we want to receive answers from Him.

item.title: Prayer—Jean
item.description: Jean shares how his membership in the church helped remind him that he could talk with his Heavenly Father through prayer.

item.title: Highlight: The Priesthood Man—Henry B. Eyring
item.description: Henry B. Eyring teaches men how they can follow—and be—examples of selfless priesthood service.

item.title: Elder and Sister Bednar- Pride
item.description: Elder and Sister Bednar discuss pride and how to work through it.

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: Pride Is Enmity
item.description: (3 Nephi 6:10–18) President Gordon B. Hinckley reads a message by President Ezra Taft Benson about the danger of pride.

item.title: The Pride Cycle
item.description: An illustration of the great pride of the people of Zarahemla about twenty years before the birth of the Savior. The prophet Nephi foretells the murder of the chief judge as a testimony of the people's wickedness.

item.title: Pride Simulation Center
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 1, Pride Simulation Center.

item.title: Steve’s Simulation
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 2, Steve’s Simulation.

item.title: Conclusion
item.description: (Jacob 2) A father takes his family to a futuristic center to learn about pride. Through a simulated experience, two young people discover aspects of pride in their own lives. Segment 3, Conclusion.

item.title: Pride
item.description: (2 Kings 5:1-19) Elder Ballard tells the story of Naaman and relates it to pride.

item.title: Our Hands, His Hands; Our Hearts, His Heart
item.description: A very independent girl with cerebral palsy learns to humble herself and ask for help.

item.title: Spiritual Crocodiles
item.description: In his April 1976 general conference addresss, President Boyd K. Packer compared well-camouflaged crocodiles who prey on unwary victims to Satan, who preys on unwary youth by camouflaging the deadly nature of sin.

item.title: Men's Hearts Shall Fail Them
item.description: Elder Russell M. Nelson shares a personal story to give encouragement for when we feel "weak in the heart."

item.title: Abide with Me
item.description: How can you find true peace and comfort when change and confusion in the world becomes overwhelming? You can find solace by turning to God in prayer. Learn how the words from the hymn 'Abide with Me' can strengthen you during times of despair.

item.title: Bullying - Stop It
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Christ and the Rich Young Ruler
item.description: Jesus Christ, the Son of God, teaches a rich man how to gain eternal life. Matthew 19:16-26

item.title: The Will of God
item.description: God uses love-inspired correction to guide us to a future we do not or cannot now envision but which He knows is the better way for us.

item.title: A Mighty Change of Heart
item.description: (Alma 5:12–14) Elder Russell M. Nelson talks about “a mighty change” of heart.

item.title: "If They Harden Not Their Hearts"
item.description: This video depicts how pride led to the apostasy of Lyman Johnson and Thomas B. Marsh (D&C 112:1-16).

item.title: Hypocrisy
item.description: (Matthew 23:2-28) Elder M. Eldon Tanner teaches of two kinds of hypocrisy.

item.title: Beware of Pride
item.description: President Ezra Taft Benson delivers a message titled "Beware of Pride"

item.title: The Weightier Matters of the Law: Judgment, Mercy, and Faith
item.description: We are to focus on the inward things of the heart, which we know and value intuitively but often neglect for that which is trivial, superficial, or prideful.

item.title: How the Church is Organized
item.description: A brief explanation of the organizational structure of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Priesthood and Priesthood Keys - We Are Brothers
item.description: A quorum comes to understand what it means to hold priesthood keys as they reach out to fellow quorum members.

item.title: Willing and Worthy to Serve
item.description: Miracles are everywhere to be found when the priesthood is understood, its power is honored and used properly, and faith is exerted.

item.title: The Powers of Heaven
item.description: Priesthood holders young and old need both authority and power—the necessary permission and the spiritual capacity to represent God in the work of salvation.

item.title: Priesthood Authority and Power
item.description: Statement by Elder David A. Bednar in the priesthood session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Priesthood Duty
item.description: A recent convert to the Church fulfills his priesthood duty by inviting all around him to come unto Christ.

item.title: Quorum Brotherhood
item.description: A quorum rallies around a young man who attended scouting activities for years. With their help, he comes to a knowledge of the truthfulness of the restored gospel, and is ordained to the Aaronic priesthood.

item.title: Aaronic Priesthood Shining Forth
item.description: Young men from around the world testify of the blessings of priesthood service and being faithful in fulfilling their Duty to God.

item.title: Preparation in the Priesthood: “I Need Your Help”
item.description: Don’t worry about how inexperienced you are or think you are, but think about what, with the Lord’s help, you can become.

item.title: The Power of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: You and the Aaronic Priesthood office you hold are essential to Heavenly Father’s work with His children and the preparation of this earth for the Second Coming.

item.title: Sanctify Yourselves
item.description: When a little league football player is struck by lightning, his 18-year-old assistant coach must be prepared to use his newly conferred Melchizedek Priesthood authority to call upon the healing powers of heaven.

item.title: Priesthood Power
item.description: May we be worthy recipients of the divine power of the priesthood we bear. May it bless our lives and may we use it to bless the lives of others.

item.title: Learning in the Priesthood
item.description: If you will be diligent and obedient in the priesthood, treasures of spiritual knowledge will be poured out upon you.

item.title: Sacred Keys of the Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: The Lord wants every Aaronic Priesthood holder to invite all to come unto Christ—beginning with his own family.

item.title: Priesthood Treasures
item.description: Quote given by President Henry B. Eyring in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: Learn Your Duty
item.description: Quote given by Brother Larry M. Gibson in the priesthood session of general conference on April 2, 2011.

item.title: My Duty to God
item.description: Out of love, a 13-year-old boy in Arizona pushed himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: Becoming a Priesthood Man: Priesthood Duty
item.description: Michael strives to be an example and strengthen those around him. What started as a pregame devotional for him and his only Latter-day Saint teammate quickly became a tradition for many people on the football team.

item.title: Something Different About Us: Example
item.description: Luis sets an example for his friend who is not a member of the Church. He said of fulfilling his duties of the Aaronic Priesthood, “I’m representing Jesus Christ, and that’s amazing."

item.title: Let Every Man Learn His Duty: Aaronic Priesthood
item.description: Young men share their feelings about what it means to be a worthy holder of the priesthood. As one young man said, “Having the priesthood changes every decision I make."

item.title: Restoration of the Priesthood
item.description: Church members share how they personally have been blessed because God's priesthood authority has been restored to the earth.

item.title: The Priesthood of Aaron
item.description: The priesthood you bear is a special gift, for the giver is the Lord Himself. Use it, magnify it, and live worthy of it.

item.title: Pride and the Priesthood
item.description: Pride is a switch that turns off priesthood power. Humility is a switch that turns it on.

item.title: The Magnificent Priesthood
item.description: Brother David L. Beck highlights the blessings that come when each young man learns and does his duty.

item.title: Highlight: The Keys and Authority of the Priesthood—Dallin H. Oaks
item.description: Dallin H. Oaks teaches how men and women, though they have different roles, serve and are blessed on the same terms through the priesthood.

item.title: The Preparatory Priesthood
item.description: Highlight of President Henry B. Eyring's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Roll Up Our Sleeves
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church.

item.title: The Welcome Table
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church.

item.title: A New Day
item.description: Latter-day Saints share their reactions to the 1978 reversal of the priesthood restriction on members of black African descent.

item.title: God's Children in Every Aspect
item.description: The face of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints reflects every race and culture and has more color, more diversity, than ever before. The gospel of Jesus Christ embraces all people.

item.title: A Person and A Sister
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church

item.title: We Come Together & Unite As One
item.description: As much as our differences enrich our collective experience, the Gospel of Jesus Christ transcends them all.

item.title: Diversity Is Good
item.description: Individual Latter-day Saints share their thoughts and experiences as members in the Church

item.title: Revelation on Priesthood Accepted, Church Officers Sustained
item.description: Revelation on Priesthood Accepted, Church Officers Sustained

item.title: The Gospel— A Global Faith
item.description: President Howard W. Hunter delivers a message titled "The Gospel— A Global Faith."

item.title: The Need for Greater Kindness
item.description: Why do any of us have to be so mean and unkind to others? Why can’t all of us reach out in friendship to everyone about us?

item.title: Doctrine of Inclusion
item.description: If we are truly disciples of the Lord Jesus Christ, we will reach out with love and understanding to all of our neighbors at all times.

item.title: When We Were Strangers
item.description: Latter-Day Saints were forced from Missouri, citizens of Quincy, Illinois offered refuge, as reflected in the writings and experiences of Elizabeth Haven Barlow.

item.title: I Was a Stranger: Love One Another
item.description: Helping a young refugee from the Ivory Coast leads to a blessed friendship for two women. For more information about how to help refugees, visit the “I Was a Stranger” website.

item.title: Refuge from the Storm
item.description: Tens of millions of people have been displaced from their homes due to conflict and famine—half of these individuals are children. Elder Patrick Kearon speaks about the Savior’s experience as a refugee, and how we can follow His example to be models of love and compassion refugees and strangers among us. For more information about how you can get involved with refugee efforts in your community, visit: IWasAStranger.lds.org.

item.title: Providing for the Refugees in Lebanon
item.description: Refugees who fled from violence in Syria to peace in Lebanon are still facing serious challenges. There are no jobs for the adults and no schools for the children. Many are going without daily necessities.

item.title: Feeding the Refugees in Beirut
item.description: When Antoinette was a young girl, her parents taught her to take care of those in need by giving them food and a place to stay. Her father told her that some day she should open a free restaurant for the hungry.

item.title: I Was a Stranger—Invite a Refugee to Dinner
item.description: Milan and her daughters are refugees from Bhutan. Michelle and her family meet them and invite them over to cook dinner together and learn about each other’s culture.

item.title: Be a Sincere Friend
item.description: Fatou, a refugee from Ivory Coast, and Toni share a love for cross-country running and develop a friendship far beyond the Big Brothers Big Sisters program.

item.title: Refugee Baby Shower: Giving One Family a New Start – Give Back by Mormon Channel
item.description: A relief society decides to heed the call from the first presidency to help refugees by throwing a refugee mother a baby shower.

item.title: Scout Troop Learns that Helping Refugees is as Easy as Riding a Bike - Give Back By Mormon Channel
item.description: A local Boy Scout troop teamed up with the IRC to build bikes for refugees in need of better transportation. It turned out to be a bonding experience that the boys would never forget.

item.title: Rescuing Refugees in Kurdistan
item.description: Refugees from Mosul in Northern Iraq were given a place to live when two brothers gave up their houses to 23 families.

item.title: Giving All for Refugees in Kurdistan
item.description: Dr. Nemam is a native of Kurdistan, a land torn apart by war. She was working in Sweden when she heard news that her people were suffering, so she decided to return and offer any help she could.

item.title: Helping Refugees in Iraq – The Mayor of Howesk
item.description: “We are not perfect, but we love helping others, because we know this is an emergency, and people in hard situations should show who they really are and be good to one another,” says the mayor.

item.title: Welcome to America: Giving Refugees New Hope with Household Goods
item.description: The Welcome to America project is a nonprofit in Phoenix that brings donated goods to refugees’ homes and helps them start their new lives.

item.title: Syrian Refugee—Emergency Response
item.description: LDS Charities partnered with local charity organizations in Jordan to provide Syrian refugees with lifesaving supplies.

item.title: Syrian Refugee - “The moment I was shot I knew I would never walk again”
item.description: With millions impacted by the Syrian civil war that broke out in 2011, many have fled for safety and refuge. Watch and listen to Nadia’s story; a 12-year-old Syrian refugee child, who while fleeing Syria, was shot in the back and paralyzed.

item.title: LDS Charities Syrian Response 2013
item.description: A short video outlining the the church's humanitarian response to the early days of the Syrian refugee crisis.

item.title: Everyday Example: Religion in the Workplace
item.description: A new series of dramatized videos produced by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints shows members how to navigate the landmine-laced terrain of the sensitive social and religious issues of the day.

item.title: Everyday Example: Prayer in School
item.description: A new series of dramatized videos produced by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints shows members how to navigate the landmine-laced terrain of the sensitive social and religious issues of the day.

item.title: Everyday Example: When Beliefs Are Questioned
item.description: A new series of dramatized videos produced by The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints shows members how to navigate the landmine-laced terrain of the sensitive social and religious issues of the day.

item.title: Mormon Apostle Promotes Religious Freedom
item.description: Elder L. Tom Perry Promotes Religious Freedom.

item.title: What Is Religious Freedom?
item.description: Cartoon drawing about religious freedom.

item.title: Preserving Religious Freedom
item.description: Preserving Religious Freedom video.

item.title: Repentance—Doug
item.description: Doug discovers there is more to life and talks about repentance.

item.title: You Can Meet God's Expectations
item.description: Quote given by Elder D. Todd Christofferson in the Sunday afternoon session of general conference on April 3, 2011.

item.title: The Sting of the Scorpion
item.description: A young boy’s encounter with a scorpion in the Arabian desert can teach us a lot about what we must do to avoid and overcome the venomous sting of sin.

item.title: Redemption
item.description: Through Christ, people can and do change their lives and obtain redemption.

item.title: The Divine Gift of Repentance
item.description: Only through repentance do we gain access to the atoning grace of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Coming Back
item.description: Statement by Elder Robert D. Hales in the Saturday afternoon session on March 31, 2012.

item.title: Prodigal Son
item.description: (Luke 15:11-32) Elder Robert D. Hales talks about the Prodigal Son.

item.title: The Shiny Bicycle
item.description: Everybody sins and makes mistakes, and even though it's not easy, with Heavenly Father's and Jesus Christ's help we can find a way to fix them and receive forgiveness.

item.title: Daily Bread: Change
item.description: Jesus Christ is the bread of eternal life. By following Him, remembering Him, and having faith in Him we can change and become what we aspire to become.

item.title: Abide with Me
item.description: How can you find true peace and comfort when change and confusion in the world becomes overwhelming? You can find solace by turning to God in prayer. Learn how the words from the hymn 'Abide with Me' can strengthen you during times of despair.

item.title: Bullying - Stop It
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf counsels us that when it comes to hating, gossiping, ignoring, ridiculing, holding grudges, or wanting to cause harm—stop it!

item.title: Highlight: Love—the Essence of the Gospel—Thomas S. Monson
item.description: Thomas S. Monson teaches how small acts of love, kindness, and forgiveness can make a big difference in others' lives.

item.title: Highlight: Spiritual Whirlwinds—Neil L. Andersen
item.description: Neil L. Andersen encourages youth to trust in God during challenges and promises that they will receive the Lord's protection and guidance.

item.title: See Others as They May Become
item.description: Quote given by President Thomas S. Monson in the Priesthood session on October 6, 2012.

item.title: “Yes, Lord, I Will Follow Thee”
item.description: Highlight of Elder Eduardo Gavarret's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: God is perfect and omnipotent... He is our Father, he loves us, and he offers the same opportunity to draw closer to him as would a loving friend. And you will do it in much the same way: speaking, listening, and doing.

item.title: Personal Revelation
item.description: A heart filled with gratitude for the blessings of life and an earnest desire to hear and follow the words of counsel will prepare the way for personal revelation

item.title: Prophets and Revelation - Hearing His Voice
item.description: A seminary class in Samoa learns that seeking revelation requires effort and action.

item.title: Reverence Invites Revelation
item.description: (Mark 11:15-18) President Boyd K. Packer teaches of the importance of reverence in receiving revelation.

item.title: The Naming of John the Baptist
item.description: John the Baptist is born. Zacharias prophesies of John’s mission to prepare the way for the Son of God. Luke 1:57-80

item.title: Continuing Revelation
item.description: Highlight of President Henry B. Eyring's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Sustaining the Prophets
item.description: Highlight of Elder Russell M. Nelson's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Trifle Not with Sacred Things
item.description: Highlight of Elder Larry S. Kacher's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Seek, Receive, Act
item.description: General conference gives us the opportunity to seek, receive, and act on personal revelation. We can receive inspired guidance to help us grow and become who Heavenly Father needs us to be.

item.title: Christine
item.description: Christine was struggling with one particular challenge, but when she heard President Uchtdorf speak at general conference, she made a commitment that would scare most of us.

item.title: Ryan
item.description: Ryan is a busy dad with active kids, who need his attention. Since general conference, he's changed his focus from screen time to family time. How have your priorities shifted in the past month?

item.title: Walter
item.description: Walter needed one message from #LDSconf and he received it. Now he's changing as a result.

item.title: Ruth
item.description: This mom wanted just one question answered when she watched general conference. Because of what she heard, her kids are now praying for peanut butter cookies and she's glad.

item.title: Upon My Holy Day – Getting Closer to God
item.description: Elder Jeffery R. Holland discusses how we can draw closer to God on the Sabbath.

item.title: Upon My Holy Day – Honoring the Sabbath
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland discusses how we can honor the Sabbath.

item.title: Upon My Holy Day – Rest and Renewal
item.description: Elder Jeffrey R. Holland discuses keeping the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: Share Your Sabbath
item.description: Each week He gives us a day for the most important things. Share what you do with it.

item.title: Saturday Is a Special Day
item.description: A video about honoring the Sabbath made by a ward in Sandy, Utah.

item.title: A Row of Sunday Shoes
item.description: Sunday is the #Bestday.

item.title: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath
item.description: 80 Ideas for the Sabbath

item.title: Sunday Sounds Different
item.description: Hear the other side. Listen to the sounds of the Sabbath. #BestDay

item.title: Everyday Distractions
item.description: Life gets a little distracting sometimes. Visit LDS.org to learn more.

item.title: Help or Hinder
item.description: Does technology help or hinder your worship?

item.title: Connect to the Spirit of God
item.description: We need a special place of refuge where we can wean ourselves from the distractions of our electronic devices by unplugging them so we can connect to the Spirit of God.

item.title: Make the Sabbath a Delight by Finding Your Ancestors
item.description: Family history is one of the many things we can do to observe and find delight on the Sabbath day.

item.title: Jesus Heals a Lame Man on the Sabbath
item.description: Jesus performs a miracle by healing an invalid on the Sabbath day. John 5:2-12

item.title: Jesus Heals a Man Born Blind
item.description: On the Sabbath day, Jesus heals a man born blind. John 9:1-41

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Cowboy at Heart, and Father of Five
item.description: Drew Johnson is a Mormon investment banker striving to stay true to his cowboy roots while raising a family of five. See more about Drew at www.mormon.org/drew

item.title: Keeping The Sabbath
item.description: (Mark 2:23-28) President Gordon B. Hinckley teaches the importance of keeping the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: Keep the Sabbath Holy
item.description: (Mark 2:27–28) President Faust about the importance of Keeping the Sabbath Day Holy. An excerpt from “The Lord’s Day,” Ensign, Nov. 1991.

item.title: Keeping Commandments 100% of the Time
item.description: A young man’s decision to keep the Sabbath day holy led to lifelong blessings.

item.title: Our Observance of the Sabbath
item.description: Our observance of the Sabbath day shows our attitude toward Jesus Christ’s sacrifice for us.

item.title: "Upon My Holy Day"
item.description: (D&C 59:9-12) Elder Holland pleads with youth to keep the Sabbath day holy.

item.title: Push Back against the World
item.description: November 4, 2007: Elder Dallin H. Oaks teaches about the importance of keeping the Sabbath day holy and counsels young adults to prepare for a long, productive life.

item.title: Avoid Distracted Driving
item.description: Distractions can lead to dangerous conditions on the road; drivers need to focus while they drive.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Makeup
item.description: Simple things like doing makeup while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Music
item.description: Simple things like getting into your music while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Phone Call
item.description: Simple things like talking on the phone while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.

item.title: Distracted Driving Safety Tip: Food
item.description: Simple things like eating while driving can take your attention away from the road and make driving unsafe. When you drive, don’t get distracted.

item.title: Interview with a Germ: Communicable Disease Safety
item.description: Join Rhonda Rhinovirus as she shares what life is like as a germ. This humorous presentation is designed to be shown to nursery workers, anyone who works with children in the primary organization and their leaders. Learn more about communicable diseases at the lds.org Safety and Health website.

item.title: Lightning Safety: An Interview with Sam Cloud
item.description: Watch “An Interview with Sam Cloud” and note the safety tips he unwittingly shares with his audience. Learn more about Lightning Safety at the lds.org Safety and Health website.

item.title: Get in Shape
item.description: This video teaches how leaders can prepare for strenuous activities. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Drowsy Driver
item.description: Watch how a driver makes the mistake of driving drowsy and the nearly catastrophic consequences. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Safety Through Planning and Relying on the Spirit
item.description: Steve Thelin, rocket scientist and scout leader, takes his scouts on a camping and hiking trip in the Grand Canyon. Watch how their advanced planning, training, preparation and listening to the Spirit led safely out of a life-threatening experience. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Tracy’s Trek—Getting Ready
item.description: Watch Tracy and Miranda prepare for their trek experience. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Tracy’s Trek—On the Trail
item.description: Watch Tracy and Miranda have a fun and safe trek. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Tracy’s Trek—Trials of the Trail
item.description: Watch Tracy and Miranda struggle and overcome the trials of trek. Visit the lds.org Safety and Health website for more information.

item.title: Laurie’s story—A Flicker of Light That Brought Me Back to the Savior
item.description: Laurie has put a gun in her mouth more than once, but her finger would always freeze on the trigger. Life isn’t always going to be pretty, but Laurie knows that with God and her family at her side, she can endure in joy and bless the lives of others.

item.title: Tonya’s Story—A Mother’s Love and Support
item.description: Andy is everything his mom could ask for. He’s a triple major, he works full-time, he’s in his elders quorum presidency, he’s the best big brother, and he’s gay. “All you can give them is love,” Tonya says. “You can’t have all the answers.”

item.title: Jessyca’s Story—Coming Out, the Most Healing Thing I Have Ever Done
item.description: Jessyca tried to keep her feelings buried; she didn’t want to admit that she was gay, but, by understanding what she wants and staying close to God, she found how she can live the gospel and be happy.

item.title: Jessyca—The Struggles and the Good That Come from Trials
item.description: Just because she understands what she wants in life doesn’t make being a gay Mormon easy. See how Jessyca uses her experience to help lift others.

item.title: Jessyca’s Three Crucial Questions That Changed Her Life
item.description: She knows that she doesn’t want to marry a man or a woman. What Jessyca does know is that she wants to remain temple worthy. Now she can make a plan for her life, trusting that God knows what’s best.

item.title: Elizabeth’s Take on Love and Understanding
item.description: Ricardo has always loved his wife, and while he hoped his feelings of same-sex attraction would disappear, they haven’t. See why his wife says being empathetic and welcoming is the best thing we can do to help members who experience same-sex attraction or identify as gay.

item.title: Ricardo’s Story—Reaching Out toward the Light
item.description: Ricardo has tried his whole life to piece together the big picture. But it wasn’t until he was able to understand his relationship with the Savior in relation to his feelings of same-sex attraction, along with the love and support of his wife, children, and friends, that he was able to find peace and authenticity.

item.title: Ricardo’s Journey through His Art
item.description: Ricardo has found peace with God while being authentic to himself by accepting the Atonement of Christ. See how he represents and describes his journey through art.

item.title: Josh’s Afterlife Analogy
item.description: Through crucial conversations with God, Josh has learned that he does not have to have all the answers about the afterlife now. He has learned that he has to exercise faith to reach ultimate happiness.

item.title: Josh’s Table Analogy
item.description: To Josh, the gospel was like being seated at a table where only those in a heterosexual relationship can partake of the gospel’s great food. Josh learned that there are many aspects of the gospel that he can partake in by being proactive and staying close to God.

item.title: Reed—A Father’s Blessing
item.description: Reed and Josh share how their relationship was deeply touched when Josh received a priesthood blessing. Josh’s same-sex attraction experience has been blessed by expressions of love from his father and other family members. This experience has brought them closer as family.

item.title: JustServe - BYU TV Documentary 2017
item.description: This 2017 BYU-TV produced documentary highlights benefits that flow when individuals and families search, sign-up for and serve others in their community through JustServe.org.

item.title: What Is a Church Community?
item.description: Mormons strive to be actively involved in their church community, believing that stronger church communities lead to a stronger society.

item.title: Dominoes
item.description: So often, our acts of service consist of simple encouragement or of giving mundane help with mundane tasks, but what glorious consequences can flow from mundane acts and from small but deliberate deeds! …

item.title: Matthew 25:40
item.description: Inasmuch as ye have done it unto one of the least of these my brethren, ye have done it unto me.

item.title: Works of God
item.description: Two families share how they have seen the works of God made manifest in their lives as ward members reach out in love and understanding.

item.title: Pass It On
item.description: Children around the world have taken President Thomas S. Monson's counsel to find a way to serve others.

item.title: The Coat
item.description: The Coat is a children’s story that depicts a young boy giving selflessly to another child in need.

item.title: Service
item.description: It is only when we love God and Christ with all of our hearts, souls, and minds that we are able to share this love with our neighbors through acts of kindness and service—the way that the Savior would love and serve all of us if He were among us.

item.title: Opportunities to Do Good
item.description: The Lord’s way to help those in temporal need requires people who out of love have consecrated themselves and what they have to God and to His work.

item.title: Dayton's Legs
item.description: A 13-year-old boy in Arizona fulfilled his Duty to God by pushing himself to the limit so that his friend, who has cerebral palsy, could participate with him in a triathlon.

item.title: What Shall We Give?
item.description: In a season known for giving and getting, President Thomas S. Monson and the Mormon Tabernacle Choir remind us of the true gifts and meaning of Christmas.

item.title: Ye Have Done it Unto Me
item.description: Jesus declares the parable of the sheep and the goats. Matthew 25:31-46

item.title: Sisterhood: Oh, How We Need Each Other
item.description: Bonnie L. Oscarson teaches that we can learn from girls and women of all ages and that we must avoid judging each other.

item.title: Wanted: Hands and Hearts to Hasten the Work
item.description: Linda K. Burton teaches that we can be devoted disciples of Jesus Christ by serving others and furthering the work of salvation.

item.title: Highlight: Are You Sleeping through the Restoration?—Dieter F. Uchtdorf
item.description: Dieter F. Uchtdorf cautions that selfishness, addictions, and competing priorities can keep us from giving our best effort as disciples of Christ.

item.title: Highlight: The Joyful Burden of Discipleship—Ronald A. Rasband
item.description: Ronald A. Rasband teaches that we can receive joy by serving each other and bearing one other's burdens as disciples of the Lord.

item.title: Our Personal Ministries
item.description: Highlight of Elder Hugo E. Martinez's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: Until We Meet Again
item.description: Highlight of President Thomas S. Monson's address at the October 2014 General Conference.

item.title: The Old Shoemaker
item.description: In this classic story by Leo Tolstoy, an honest old shoemaker discovers that by helping those around him, he was really serving the Savior.

item.title: Standards: Sexual Purity and Modesty - True Confidence
item.description: Two young women share their secret for confidence and self-worth: the companionship of the Holy Ghost.

item.title: I'm a Mormon, New York Comedian, and Dreamer
item.description: Jenna Kim Jones' favorite sound is laughter. She would do almost anything to hear it–anything except compromise her principles. She's proving being funny doesn't have to mean being crude. See more at www.mormon.org/jenna

item.title: Sermon on the Mount: The Beatitudes
item.description: Jesus describes the characteristics of true Christians. Matthew 5:3-16

item.title: I'm a Mormon, Former Ballerina, and Fashion Executive
item.description: Athelia Lesueur, a Mormon ballerina, always thought her life would be dance. When health challenges derailed her plans, Athelia discovered another passion: fashion. Visit Athelia's page at mormon.org/Athelia

item.title: The Lost Purse

item.description: Despite the opposition, trials, and temptations, you need not fail or fear.

item.description: While doing what's right is not always popular, Tanya has become president of her school by being a true friend to those around her.

item.title: Mormon Mustang
item.description: While flying in a historic airplane, youth learn about the dangers of pushing the envelope.

item.title: 195 Dresses
item.description: Have you ever noticed how hard it is to find a modest prom dress? One young woman in Arizona came up with a solution for her community.

item.title: Stand Tall
item.description: A tall young woman named Brooke tells how it feels to be an unusual height.

item.title: You Can Meet God's Expectations
item.description: Quote given by Elder D. Todd Christofferson in the Sunday afternoon session of general conference on April 3, 2011.

item.title: Message from President Thomas S. Monson
item.description: President Thomas S. Monson discusses the importance of the standards contained in the For the Strength of Youth booklet.

item.title: A Brand New Year: Physical health
item.description: The Lord has commanded us to take good care of our bodies. This involves eating nutritious food, exercising regularly, and getting enough sleep. In this video, youth from around the world talk about staying healthy and obeying the Word of Wisdom.

item.title: Within Bounds
item.description: Staying in bounds—on the ski slopes and in life—leads to joy and safety.

item.description: One boy’s crusade to encourage clean language has far-reaching effects.

item.title: Sitting on the Bench: Thoughts on Suicide Prevention

item.title: Craig’s Story

item.title: Sheina's Story
item.description: Sheina felt trapped by her depression. She convinced herself that suicide was the only way to end her pain. Listen to Sheina’s story of recovery and faith through ongoing challenges.

item.description: Teaching in the Savior’s Way: Worldwide Training Broadcast

item.description: Sheldon F. Child, “Tithing: The Best Choice,” Friend, Feb. 2010, 32–33 From a general conference talk given in April 2008. Bring ye all the tithes into the storehouse (3 Nephi 24:10).

item.title: Welcome to the 2014 Annual Auxiliary Training: Sunday School

item.title: Living the Gospel Brings Power
